Job_Description:
Overview
The Bank of New York Mellon is seeking an experienced Java Developer to be responsible for delivering implementations for technical solutions. The Java developer will work with the team and develop the application, unit test, and deploy.

Responsibilities:
Designs solutions, carries out development tasks, and guides junior team members in development and L3 production support.
Works with the application software development services for small to very large complex projects.
Responsible for all facets of the BNYM development life cycle from Planning through Implementation.
Coordinates testing efforts to ensure a high-quality product for implementation.
Collaborates with team members to perform all change management practices and policies related to coding, testing and implementation activities.
Contributes to estimates and project plans.
Provides guidance on best practices to junior team members.
Awareness and compliance of all risk and compliance controls.
Conducts reviews of the test Plans and test Data.
May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project.
Ensures application performance standards are appropriately defined and achieved.
Collaborates with the business partners to identify and implement appropriate solutions.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Principal, Database Developer
Job_Description:
Job Overview:
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. The job holder leads the technical design, development and documentation of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. S/he analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, and logical processes and interfaces with other systems. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation. Must have thorough and demonstrative knowledge on or both the user-side frontend of a website, as well as the backend, server-side that powers the user-side. Additional requirements include intermediate understanding of security principles, relational databases and architecture design principles. Programming well-designed, testable, efficient code. Analyze, design and develop tests and test-automation suites. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and solutions. Maintain software functionality and currency (technical debt and gain). Actively participate in code reviews. Integrate software components into a fully functional software system. Apply security and privacy principles. Execute full lifecycle software development. Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures. Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems. Ensure software is updated with latest features. Participate in deployment process following all change controls. Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms. Provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Active learning engagement. Complete all required mandatory training / policy awareness curricula on time. Use learning tools such as Pluralsight to complete both recommended and aspirational targets set in personal development plans. Demonstrate team work. Leverage existing products/functionality and promote reuse. Work alongside other engineers on the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices. Collaborate closely with all the other members of the team to take shared responsibility for the overall efforts that the team has committed to. Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, business users, project managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions. Utilize local meetups to gain and share knowledge. Compiles documentation written by more senior developers of all procedures used in system. Acts as mentor to junior level engineers. Prior experience with using a specific application development toolkit and knowledge of front end and backend development coding languages such as C#, Java, HTML, NodeJS, CSS, JSON, Angular, JavaScript. Must also have proficiency in Core Spring, ANSI, Docker. Communications and organization skills; team work skills. N/A. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.

Overview
The Bank of New York Mellon seeks Principal, Back-End Developer in Pittsburgh, PA to consult with internal business groups to provide high-level application software development services or technical support for backed features and components.
...REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field and nine (9) years of progressively responsible experience in the job offered or a related occupation: Utilizing Data Modelling and SQL to store customer reference data and customer invoice account information; Using DB2 to store various invoices and payment details of customer which are used to report on the frontend; Using MQ to collect messages from a dependent source system and process the transaction data; Utilizing Java to conduct Data Cleansing and Data enrichment in a Hadoop file system; Conduct data processing using ESP to schedule jobs based on the client data frequency; and Using Unix and Shell Scripting to conduct data enrichment and data processing prior to data being sent to billing tool. Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: User Experience Designer
Job_Description:
Overview Sr. Specialist User Experience - >
We are actively seeking an energetic and innovative UX Designer to join our group. The Visual Designer (VD) role is an integral part of the team. BNY Mellon IMT is embarking on a transformation into the user experience by incorporating strong Product and Design discipline into the work and services we create.
Create and evolve the visual design language for the products we work on while maintaining awareness of the larger ecosystem of product and design standards.

The products we design must add value while adding minimal complexity. To do our job well, we utilize creative design-led techniques to help us break through the industry jargon and bureaucracy and find insights that others can’t. We elevate UX not just to solve users’ problems but also to use design to steer the product’s evolution into a powerful and extensible framework. You’ll support our client-first mindset to drive efficiency and effectiveness. The successful candidate will join this unique and specialized team that provides clean product design and delivery through the tech team. Working in a professional capacity as a visual designer on highly interactive and data rich applications.

Who We Are
UX Center of Excellence (UX CoE) is part of BNY Mellon Investment Management. Our goal is to improve the User Experience for advisors and customers, ushering in the future tools of Investment Management. Adapting the Lean UX principles, we work closely with teams to shorten the feedback loop and learn from every iteration.

For over 230 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $15 billion in revenues and market capitalization of approximately $50 billion.

About You
Expert at User-centric design approach that involves rapid testing and iteration of designs
You can think through user pain points, find reasonable solutions, mock them up and spec it in detail, and work with engineers to build them
Expert in iconography and building them from scratch
Enjoys the multi-disciplinary and collaborative nature of product development (SDLC)
Detail-oriented and you have a problem-solving mindset
Experience with agile and lean UX methodology and deliverables
Can confidently translate business problems and requirements into compelling wireframes
Experience working in a cross-functional organization, achieving goals through partnership and collaboration (Building relationships with stakeholders)
Ability to work in ambiguity and draw insights from broad data sources
You stay up to date on the industrial latest UX design trends
Strong presentation and communication skills, critical creative thinker and excellent work quality
Be an exceptional multi-tasker who’s quick and organized
Required Qualifications
Minimum (5) years of experience required
Portfolio must be available for review
Expert user of Figma, Sketch, Invision, Axure RP, Jira, Adobe Creative Suite
Design for mobile devices (native and web mobile applications) iOS and Android
Responsive Design for web applications and Branding building a design system
Experience hands-on research, wireframing, prototyping, user personas, journey maps, story maps and user stories at an interactive agency or design studio.
Bachelor's degree in psychology, user experience, computer science, design, human computer interaction, related discipline, or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated ability to work and manage multiple priorities on concurrent, rigorous deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment.
Knowledge of Accessibility / ADA compliance is a plus
Building short animation clips is a plus
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: User Experience Designer
Job_Description:
Overview
Who we are
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of June 30, 2022, BNY Mellon had $43.0 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $1.9 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.

BNY Mellon Marketing & Communications
It’s an exciting time to join the BNY Mellon Marketing & Communications team. Our team is focused on delivering brand recognition, growth, increased client loyalty and employee engagement. We are a world-class, integrated marketing and communications organization, aligned around the needs our clients and the industry.

Role description and opportunities (describe the role and opportunity)
We are looking for a candidate who can bring a modern approach to design for the BNY Mellon brand through a relentless drive to explore every angle of a design challenge.


Developing visually compelling and breakthrough designs across media and platforms
Constant evolution, seeking to set a new bar for design excellence on every project
Exploration, striving to express ideas in innovative, yet intuitive ways
Concepting, designing, and providing direction for modern data visualization, infographics, and other visual storytelling assets
Strong design fundamentals, including composition, typography, color, iconography
The ability to produce work that is ambitious but remains conceptual and focused down to the smallest details

Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and work experience preferred
Possess both strategic and effective marketing and communication skills to help drive projects with Marketing managers
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast paced, results-driven, team-oriented environment
Experience working within and supporting marketing teams
5-8 years of total work experience within financial services, advertising, marketing industry is preferred
Digital design skills are primary but extend to creating for offline and experiential
A strong understanding of web/social media best practices and trends
Ability to work within brand guidelines while always seeking to innovate and evolve
Ability to manage multiple projects efficiently and effectively under strict timelines
Can shepherd projects from concept phase through to final release
Strong presentation abilities; Able to clearly articulate design decisions to a variety of partners
Can interface easily and fluently with colleagues in UX and tech and partners across the firm
Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop, Sketch (After Effects and Premiere a plus)

Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Overview
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance and technology. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 237 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our ability to evolve, lead and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re more than 50k+ employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself.
Bring your ideas. Make history .
Software Engineering & Technology University Program (S.E.T.U.P)
S.E.T.U.P (Software Engineering & Technology University Program) is an 18-month entry-level technology program that is designed to develop and retain high-potential talent.
The goal of this program is to build a team of technology professionals who are prepared and positioned to contribute to BNY Mellon's technology strategy and initiatives. This program is an immense development and learning opportunity for students with a passion for Technology.
Program highlights
The S.E.T.U.P program is an opportunity not only to learn and grow, but an experience full of diverse community connections, executive engagement, and memorable events. You unlock your full potential here! How? You’re empowered to solve problems and brainstorm ideas in your own unique way.
BNY offers the opportunity to have a direct impact on a wide range of projects, and to create and deliver successful solutions to our clients through a collaborative team setting.
Support for career development and networking from an array of corporate leaders, such as executive mentors, peer mentors, and program managers.
Robust onboarding and training curriculum designed specifically for S.E.T.U.P participants. Gain cross-functional skills by attending learning & development sessions designed by subject matter experts.
After successful completion of the program, high performing SETUPs are aligned to a technology team that would help them utilize and advance the skills acquired during the program.
The possibilities are limitless here - you’ll gain the skills required to advance your career and have a significant impact on our business !!!


US: *New York, NY *Jersey City, NJ


Apply scientific methods to find solutions to real business problems.
Perform data analysis, feature engineering, and advanced methods to prepare and develop decisions based on data.
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Provide insight into observed business outcomes through analytics.
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies in data.
Automate data analysis and streamline analytical processes
Provide recommendations based on data trends uncovered when possible
Stays abreast of organization and management changes and has in-depth knowledge of company practices relevant to data science products.
Machine Learning, Feature Engineering and Advanced Analytics capabilities. Stressing expertise in the core functional areas: Computer Programming, Math & Analytic Methodology, Distributed computing, and communications of complex results.


Must be enrolled in an accredited university/college pursuing bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (i.e., Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a similar major with extensive Data Science, Statistics, or related fields.)
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above
Does not require sponsorship for employment visa status (now or in the future) in the region where applying


A great attitude and desire for learning
Excellent problem solving, written and oral communication skills
Disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently or in close collaboration
Smart and driven individual who is passionate about learning new technologies
0-2 years of experience in software development preferred. Previous technology internship is a plus

Job_Description:
Overview
Job Title
Executive Assistant (Global Client Management)
Who we are
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of Dec. 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $46.7 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $2.4 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news
What we do
Global Client Management (GCM) positions BNY Mellon as provider and partner of choice for the largest, most complex, fastest growing, and most strategic global client relationships. The team identifies major opportunities and drives growth and service delivery around “top of mind” strategic issues. Key to this role is delivering the entirety of BNY Mellon’s resources and capabilities across businesses and geographies, with a focus on growth and enhanced connectivity to the client C-suite and key influencers.
Role and Responsibilities
In this role, you will be responsible for
Independently completing a full range of advanced administrative activities, in support of one or more executives, who are responsible for leading a small business unit or group and Senior Leadership.
Supporting executive(s) in completing activities required for the management of teams responsible for similar tasks.
Effectively prioritizing the needs of the office, executive(s) and/or team as prescribed by established guidelines, managing competing requests and switching focus as needed, often must negotiate prioritization of administrative activities with/among higher level team members/managers.
Performing advanced, diversified and often confidential administrative duties requiring broad and comprehensive experience, skill and knowledge of organizational policies and procedures.
Scheduling meetings, prepares and distributes meeting agendas and minutes.
Making travel arrangements and maintains calendar of appointments for assigned executive(s) and/or team.
Potentially leading on projects related to administrative initiatives.
Creating and disseminating draft/final draft correspondence, copies, files, and processes related documentation independently
Appling discretion to triage and manage complex, sensitive situations resulting from a wide range of requests, questions and problems directed toward the assigned office, executive(s) and/or team.
Reviewing and analyzing complex data, assist with expense management and development of budgets, accounts payables/receivables on behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team.
Liaising with the executive(s) and direct reports to prepare budget presentations for review and use by the assigned executive(s).
Completing billing and expense activities, managing supply orders and resolving associated issues on behalf of the office, executive(s) and/or team.
Timeliness, quality, and accurate completion of own work as well as effective collaboration with leadership and the executive's direct reports/wider team on behalf of the executive.


5-7 years of total work experience preferred.
Bachelor's degree in lieu of some experience may be considered.
High school/secondary school or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required, bachelor s degree preferred.
Applicable vocational training (e.g., courses on relevant business software like the Microsoft Office Suite of products, basic business writing, or similar) preferred, AA degree or relevant business certifications preferred.
Is an intermediate to advanced user of standard business software (word processing, e-mail, spreadsheets, etc.)
Effective collaboration and communication skills are required, including information exchange with internal and external contacts.
Tact, diplomacy, and confidentiality are essential skills based on the level of internal and external contacts.
Where proficiency in standard activities within a professional discipline is pertinent (e.g., Human Resources, Finance, etc.), relevant degree or industry certifications for the discipline are desirable.

Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Overview

Who we are:
For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.
BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers


In Custody, Tax & Network, we provide quality, timely and easy-to-access information to help clients meet complex custody needs while maximizing efficiency and measuring and managing risk. Our global footprint and local expertise helps to deliver insight and solutions across every stage of the investment lifecycle. Our worldwide network of markets with 24-hour global coverage and monitoring of sub-custodial performance is the bedrock of our services.
Our integrated technology is designed to simplify your workflow. We offer digital solutions and tools for better insights into your daily cash activity, transactions, and holdings with the ability to seamlessly integrate data from our system directly into your applications.
As the Agile Lead for Global Custody Tax & Network you will spearhead the effort to transform the organization to Agile Methodology. In partnership with your technology counterpart, you will lead training on process and tooling for the product development organization.


Assess current state of organization and develop a plan to migrate the organization to Agile in partnership with Technology
Support the vision, execution, measurement and outcomes for a product or functional area by identifying Agile tools and processes that can be used across the organization
Establish and support Agile Champions, Center of Excellence, and facilitate training
Sustain transparent and consistent communications to all constituents
Providing transparent / repeatable content and resources for continuous uplifting
Be conversant on BNYM waterfall/ legacy project practices so that future agile roadmap can close gaps on in house tools and processes vs Agile methodology and tools
Be aware of mindful of Enterprise audit/regulatory requirements for project execution and ensure proper compliance is followed
Identify and help Implement solutions and goals to improve and optimize efficient agile operation / agile maturity
Common templates and solutions
Metrics and measurements
Driving expanding/up skilling
Auditability


Highly experienced with Agile/Scrum (Jira tooling must have, Blueprint desired)
Balance of technical knowledge and business acumen
Customer first / thinking mind set
Proactive, self-starter with excellent project management skills and ability to manage multiple tasks effectively
Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire partners and stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment
High degree of organization, individual initiative, and personal accountability


Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience in business management or related field is required. 10-12 years of total work experience in Project Management preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of Agile experience (Agile release management)
Proven track record of delivering solutions with a customer-first mindset
Established background in launching software or services in partnership with engineering teams and high degree of proficiency working with iterative development, understanding of Agile principles
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.

Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
What You'll Do:
Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing), along with approximately 350 other applications used by the following high-priority business services and their clients.
The CMIST Centers of Excellence govern best practices across the organization. Supporting functions include financial planning, portfolio / program / project management, technology risk management, as well as communications and employee engagement. The teams also provide strategic guidance for enterprise technology programs for application resiliency and infrastructure modernization. In addition, the COEs are responsible for production application administration and incident management, as well as mainframe development and quality engineering standards.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Job Overview:
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. The job holder leads the technical design, development and documentation of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. S/he analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, and logical processes and interfaces with other systems. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation. Must have thorough and demonstrative knowledge on or both the user-side frontend of a website, as well as the backend, server-side that powers the user-side. Additional requirements include intermediate understanding of security principles, relational databases and architecture design principles. Programming well-designed, testable, efficient code. Analyze, design and develop tests and test-automation suites. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and solutions. Maintain software functionality and currency (technical debt and gain). Actively participate in code reviews. Integrate software components into a fully functional software system. Apply security and privacy principles. Execute full lifecycle software development. Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures. Job Title:

Who we are:
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. Global Client Management (GCM) positions BNY Mellon as provider and partner of choice for the largest, most complex, fastest growing, and most strategic global client relationships. The team identifies major opportunities and drives growth and service delivery around “top of mind” strategic issues. Key to this role is delivering the entirety of BNY Mellon’s resources and capabilities across businesses and geographies, with a focus on growth and enhanced connectivity to the client C-suite and key influencers.
Role Description
BNYM is seeking to hire a dynamic, self-motivated Business Manager to support the Global Client Management organization (GCM). This role will be an integral part to the GCM team and will provide support to the business and will be critical in driving analysis, process improvement, financial analysis and controls, as well as delivering on strategic initiatives.
Responsibilities
Act as a thought partner and trusted senior advisor to the Head of Global Client Management, with the ability to provide council and transparency
Ability to build key relationships and collaborate with Head of GCM, the leaders within GCM and Business Heads across the company and remove obstacles while obtaining stakeholder buy-in and driving implementation
Determine business specific priorities, establish the strategic direction and develop key performance-based metrics for the GCM organization
Assist in driving opportunities to transform and optimize the team to improve the end-to-end client experience
Prepare and communicate strategy, performance and priorities to a broad audience, including senior management, across the organization, including monthly business reviews with Head of GCM.
Provide comprehensive transparency and tracking of GCM performance metrics and financials – includes ownership of MIS, Metrics, management reporting, budgets, location strategy, planning of investments, revenue management, headcount, etc.
Chair and develop content for various forums and meetings with senior audiences
Ability to collect information, synthesize, package and effectively communicate to various levels of the organization
Facilitate decision making and business progression
Proactively focus on problem identification and problem solving
Drive competitive benchmarking and market analysis
Assist in planning and drive the execution of committed to goals including headcount, expenses and investment and productivity initiatives
Oversight to ensure that the business is run in an efficient and controlled manner, including tracking against budgets/plans and key financial ratios and effective management of direct and indirect costs
Develop, lead and implement GCM strategy for resource allocation and project staffing.
Drive partnership between business and functional teams (e.g. technology, operations, HR, marketing, etc.) to achieve business objectives
Partner with others in Finance & Business Management (CFOs, Business Managers, P&A leads) across regions and businesses to share best practice and drive consistency across the bank
Directs all administrative and departmental functions for the GCM organization
Responsible for managing employee engagement and people related activities including requisitions, promotions, approval processes, etc.


Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or related area
10-15 years of experience in financial services, business management or related function
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Good judgement, maturity and poise to enable interaction/influencing of senior management
Thoughtful analytical skills; able to develop, clearly present and draw conclusions
Self-starter; ability to prioritize, multi-task and meet deadlines
Disciplined approach to managing processes and controls
Energetic, self-motivated and effective under pressure
Strong analytical and data manipulation skills; proficient in Microsoft Office – Excel, PowerPoint
Strong project management and presentation skills
Financial Services acumen or experience in Financial Services is preferred

BNY Mellon Marketing & Communications
It’s an exciting time to join the BNY Mellon Marketing & Communications team. Our team is focused on delivering brand recognition, growth, increased client loyalty and employee engagement. We are a world-class, integrated marketing and communications organization, aligned around the needs of our clients and the industry.

The Events & Experiences Center of Excellence (COE) drives the global strategic vision for BNY Mellon events through collaboration, consistent best practices, and effective governance structures with a focus on delivering high-quality events that enable client engagement and drive our growth strategy. Our team is filled with highly motivated self-starters who consistently push the boundaries of innovation.
We are seeking a strong leader to manage our newly formed Event Operations & Analytics team and support our growing demand for more focused, data-driven performance and scalable operations. This specialized role reports directly to the Head of Events & Experiences and supports our events function in several core areas, including leadership and management of the event operations team, oversight and analysis of event metrics and ROI measurement, tradeshow and exhibit property management, vendor onboarding, and event budgeting and reporting. This is a highly cross-functional role that requires both strategic and tactical execution, strong program management, and the ability to lead a team.

Support the Events & Experiences COE in all aspects of event operations and analytics; exercise and implement best-in-class event operating practices and make recommendations to improve efficiencies.
Provide leadership to the Event Operations and Analytics team, as well as mentorship, coaching, performance evaluations, and guidance on career planning. Create and lead an agile function.
Partner with Digital Marketing & Demand Gen team to establish reporting templates and regularly report event KPIs and performance metrics.
Generate monthly and quarterly reviews and event budget reports; prepare presentations to be shared directly with CMO and Executive Committee.
Develop and manage a scalable “Event In a Box” solution to provide self-service model for lower tier events.
Oversee the administration and usage of our Cvent and Welcome platforms, ensuring the COE is leveraging the full capabilities of both tools.
Manage all aspects of our tradeshow/exhibit properties inventory and serve as engagement manager for our exhibit vendors globally; manage and maintain the firm’s Exhibit Properties Guide and ensure brand alignment.
Manage and oversee the administrative processes associated with the team’s event cards, sports tickets and branded merchandise/gifting.
Manage vendor relationships, new vendor onboarding, and ensure adherence to third-party governance policy.
Champion all standards, policies and procedures; monitor and keep the team abreast of firm policy and procedure updates and notable compliance changes to mitigate risk for our events.
Manage and maintain the COE’s intranet site/digital playbook.
Build and maintain relationships with cross-functional internal teams, creative services, digital marketing, etc.
A successful candidate should ideally have these qualifications:
High-energy self-starter with proven track record and experience managing event/marketing operations and data reporting.
Experience successfully leading and managing a team.
Command of project management principles and ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines with strong judgment and minimal supervision.
Experience managing KPIs, performance measurement, budgeting and reporting.
Event tradeshow experience, with an understanding of exhibit property management.
Experience with event tech tools, including Webex, Microsoft teams, BrightTalk, and Cvent. Natural comfort level and eagerness to learn new applications and systems.
Demonstrated level of confidence and professionalism interfacing with both internal and external business partners and senior executives at all levels, including C-suite.
Proactive and collaborative multitasker with strong and effective communications skills.
A passionate and high-energy style and positive mind-set.
Bachelor's degree in hospitality, marketing or communications or the equivalent combination of education and work experience required.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite, expert knowledge of Excel pivot tables is a must.
8+ years of related experience in events, preferably in financial services.

Overview
Collateral Operations Team Lead (19925)
Lead Analyst, Client Service (70104)
Grade: I
Hiring Manager: Steven Smith

Who We Are

For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.

BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers

What We Do

Collateral Operations Group Overview
The Collateral Operations group is a global team within the Global Operations & Technology division of BNY Mellon responsible for supporting our clients’ collateral and portfolio reconciliations processes. Our clients include pension funds, endowments, mutual funds, hedge funds and other financial institutions using derivatives to manage their financial risks. We provide processing, inquiry and general support for our clients while working to improve and automate transaction processing systems. We are a center of excellence maximizing specific knowledge around the collateralization of complex derivative products, including swaps, options, forwards, and futures.

Collateral Operations Team Lead Role Overview
The Team Lead will provide daily collateral management and/or collateral reconciliation support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including monitoring collateral inflows from counterparties, facilitating margin dispute resolution between parties and verifying delivery of collateral to clients and brokers. Also included is assisting in the end-to-end reconciliation process, providing oversight of workflow, and ensuring accuracy of information provided to all parties. The successful candidate will handle complex problem resolution and will serve as the intermediary for issue resolution with counter parties and clients. This role will involve client facing exposures. The successful candidate will also participate as a stakeholder in technology projects and enhancements related to collateral infrastructure including for new client onboarding’s. As part of their role, we expect them to supervise a small-to-medium team performing the above actions. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Role-Specific Responsibilities
Oversight of day-to-day client service delivery and quality control
Conduct behavior-based interviews and on-board new team members
Manage resource utilization/load balance, planning, and optimization
Train and develop team members – succession planning and bench strength
Assess operating risks and ensure proper controls
Interface with clients and third parties on service delivery items ensuring we are exceeding client expectations
Demonstrate trust and integrity in all that we do
Foster a positive client relationship and appropriately manage client requests whether directly with the client or internally
Work effectively with peers across teams and sites to create, modify and sustain best practices – demonstrate willingness to be a change agent
Articulate, plan and execute resource utilization/load balancing and optimization across teams
Effectively make day to day decisions independently demonstrating ability to appropriately escalate
Demonstrate proactive engagement with team members in explaining processes and sharing knowledge – explain the “why”
Lead effective meetings with proper agendas both internally and with clients/external parties
Provide facts, details and proposed solutions as items arise; taking ownership to identify solution

Standard Job Responsibilities
Works with external clients to resolve complex day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Supports clients in addressing and resolving complex operational and technical issues and ensuring requests are executed. Applies advanced problem-solving skills, judgement, and experience to analyze information. Uses developed communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides individuals at assigned clients information related to BNY Mellon's products and services representing an array of lines of business and geographies; leverages an in-depth understanding of broader BNY Mellon services and offerings. Proactively assists clients in reviewing potential business needs and directs them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon. May be the central point of contact for business development and assume client onboarding and/or risk management responsibilities
Resolves complex or non-routine client issues or inquires, as needed.
Uses in-depth knowledge of client issues and needs to contribute to business development efforts. Uses understanding of BNY Mellon products and services to best propose expanded offerings to clients for front office consideration.
Leads and participates in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience. Helps develop process improvements.
No direct reports; provides guidance to less experienced team members.
Supports multiple, complex client accounts.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Five to seven (5-7) years of total work experience is preferred.
More than one (1+) year working with derivatives products or two OR more (2+) years working in financial services.
Experience in an operational area and/or client services is preferred. At least one (1) year of team lead or supervisory e

Job_Description:
Overview
Treasury Services Technology (TST) is a premier technology organization that supports the Treasury Services (TS) business. TST provides technology solutions that enable clients to move money and associated information quickly, safely, and reliably around the world. We partner with our business and operations colleagues to deliver high-quality performance in global payments, trade services, and cash management. Together, we are able to combine diverse services into solutions that help clients streamline transactions, optimize cash flow, manage liquidity, and make payments more efficiently in capital markets around the world. Treasury Services is leveraging the expertise of our talent to drive our digital journey. Within Treasury Services, digital can be viewed as the intersection of our business functions with technology, which acts as an enabler for digitization.
The Global Payments and Liquidity function within TST enables the clearing and settlement of payments across the globe, electronic and paper-based payables/receivables solutions and deposit account servicing and management of client’s cash.
The Bank of New York Mellon is seeking an experienced Technical Project Manager. The Technical Project Manager will manage software development work efforts ranging from PI based Agile Deliveries on Demand to large multi-year transformations.


Leads and provides direction and guidance for a wide array of activities associated with project planning and management to ensure that projects are completed on time, within budget and to client specifications.
Manages and oversees the end-to-end project management activities such as project reporting, project planning, issue / risk identification and tracking, scope management, estimation, client management, relationship management, and other project documentation preparation for projects of medium to high business complexity (involving multiple systems interfaces that are highly visible to the organization).
Directs and controls all work performed within the framework of the Work Structure.
Develops detailed project plans and schedules application/infrastructure projects, including goals, risks, and resource allocation.
Monitors project results for significant deviations.
Manages vendor and client relations to ensure that service expectations are developed and met.
Maintains regular contact with clients and coordinates and reports on project progress and accomplishments. May provide input for (project) team member performance appraisals.
Works with all required Information Technology functions and groups to effectively plan and execute the project. May coordinate resources across organizational boundaries.
Serves as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification.
Manages communication with the business at a detailed functional level and discusses/resolves issues.
Manages client expectations and ensures project delivery in conformance with company software development life cycle methodologies. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.
Qualifications
This is talent pipeline requisition.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Overview
Who We Are
For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.
BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers

What We Do
Enterprise Change Resiliency Office Overview (ECRO)
The ECRO for BNY Mellon, a first-line enterprise-wide office, which leads the Firm’s change management and resiliency functions.
Enterprise Change Office Overview (ECO)
In order to strengthen an Enterprise-wide approach to Program Delivery and establish a scalable resilient operating model that builds delivery capabilities across Technology, Operations, the lines of business and support functions, BNY Mellon has evolved how we deliver programs of change across the bank. As part of this strategy, a new ECO has been created to provide central oversight, governance, and strategic execution. The ECO establishes policy and performs a governance function with select enterprise program delivery accountability founded on a federated model that partners with the program delivery teams from Technology, Operations, the lines of business and other functional areas across the organization.

Job Responsibilities
Consults with stakeholders to analyze, define, and prioritize business requirements and functional and operational specifications for a functional work stream.
Formulates and defines program scope and objectives for the work stream with thorough understanding of business processes in a specific business domain.
Represents the business to all areas of IT in resolving issues and developing technology solutions.
Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes business requirements.
Translates into functional design and use case models.
Develops project scope and identifies objectives, constraints, issues, risks and assumptions for large programs.
Is accountable for overall delivery of assigned functional work stream on a large-scale program.
Aligns resources, seeks input from key constituents, and manages others to achieve desired results.
Provides guidance on development of the functional requirements and user documentation. Assists in developing implementation/conversion strategy and implementation plan.
Manages scope and change throughout the initiative utilizing formal change control and requirements traceability.
Gathers and analyzes information and develops recommendations to address major business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Works with business and technology teams to develop technology roadmap strategy.
Trains users on new or enhanced applications and/or systems of higher complexity. Serves as point of contact or subject matter expert for the business on specific systems.
Provides technical consultation concerning business implications of complex application development projects.
Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems and provides guidance to junior team members on complex testing tasks including case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution.
Uses deep expertise and broad knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required, advanced degree is preferred.
Six to eight (6-8) years of experience in providing consulting advice to Senior IT and Business Management is required.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Preferred Qualifications
Business Analysis and technical experience within a complex eco-system including multiple system applications is preferred, as well as some experience managing enterprise wide programs is highly desired.
Transformation/Process Change experience is preferred.
Experience supporting clients within multiple lines of business is preferred.

Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Overview Job Title: Specialist, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis

Who we are:
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of Dec. 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $46.7 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $2.4 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.


The Treasury Services business with BNY Mellon services the payments, liquidity management and trade financing needs of our clients in the US and internationally, assisting them in their efforts to optimize cash flow, ensure adequate liquidity and manager risk – all essential components to their success.
Today, we are a recognized leader, influencing the industry, assisting our client through changes in our environment and guiding them toward new technologies that will lay the foundation for their long-term success, while also meeting their very real need to continue to use the proven solutions they have traditionally relied upon. We continue to strive to bring faster processes, simpler interactions, actionable data and insights into what rapidly evolving digital solutions promise to deliver in the future. And, while we are committed to the digital transformation of our industry, we also want our clients to know that we are balancing the enthusiasm with a continued focus on providing the stability and reliability they have come to expect from us. We deliver our solutions with a dedication to unsurpassed customer satisfaction, an approach that has continually earned us excellent customer service ratings.


Global Client Support, Specialist, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Independently works with internal and external datasets and client reference data and participates in the development of statistical, financial and/or econometric models for analyzing asset performance, securities data, derivative pricing, risk exposure or other sophisticated concepts. Provides analytical project management support for assigned area.


With minimal guidance, supports assigned area with advanced, complex statistical and quantitative analyses. Contributes to the development of the techniques and methodologies to be used for each type of activity/analysis. Leads data modeling and quantitative analysis projects and serves as resource to less experienced colleagues.
Uses technology tools to conduct analyses; applies techniques such as SQL and querying and macro development to extract data for populating models. As an advanced user, may do some light programming or system configuration in order set up sophisticated models or algorithms.
Understands the relevant processes and products in assigned area and which analyses, methodologies and approaches best support assessment of performance, risk, or valuation. Begins to lead complex projects in support of new or evolving processes/products.
Interprets findings, prepares standard and ad-hoc reports and delivers results to management and/or other leaders. Provides recommendations for addressing observed outcomes. Translates complex technical concepts and analyses to non-technical audiences.
Reviews accuracy of reports and calculations performed by less experienced colleagues.


Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Advanced degree in quantitative analysis preferred.
5-7 years experience preferred.
Experience in quantitative finance and technology preferred.

Technology Services Group (TSG) powers BNY Mellon by providing scale, capacity and capability to deliver the critical technology required to operate the global financial services markets.

Creative innovators, delivering excellence and simplicity
Always doing the right thing for the bank, colleagues and clients

Our Data and Analytics Solutions (D&A) is a public- and private-cloud-based software and content offering that builds client-centric data, technology, and content capabilities. Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing), along with approximately 350 other applications used by the following high-priority business services and their clients.

Who We Are:
As a global investments company, BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Every day, our Technology employees make this happen while also seeking out new ways to do it more efficiently and effectively.
As part of BNY Mellon’s global Technology organization, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with some of the best and brightest, technology, business, and financial minds to find new and better ways to exceed our clients’ expectations and build the future of financial services. With more than 230 years of industry leading experience under our belts, you might even say that we are the original fintech.
What You'll Be Doing:

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Overview
Junior level Middle Office Analyst
Who We Are
For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world's leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity. We are working in a Flexible work environment with the option to work a few days from home. Occasional Weekend and Holiday work to be expected.
BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world's leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world's largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers
What We Do
Investment Operations Solutions (Middle Office) Overview
At BNY Mellon, our data-centric service model helps provide clients with clean, scrubbed information to support the investment process, from post-trade execution to client communications. Our Investment Operations solution is a full lifecycle of investment activities through an integrated data, technology and operations model that supports all product types. Offering a full spectrum of services: trade support, derivatives and collateral management, bank loan support, investment book of record (IBOR), investment performance, and data management.
The Trade Support team is the first touch point for our clients' investment activity. We work hand and hand with our investment manager clients, internal teams, custodians, and brokers to capture, confirm, communicate, and settle executed trade activity. Our team provides analytical services to ensure all the activity is processed timely and accurately to meet client and market deadlines.
Middle Office Role Overview
Under minimal supervision, performs moderately complex functions supporting trading, client services, and accounting activities including trade communication, processing, and settlement. Reviews high volumes of client trade activity where established procedures are followed. Leverages some knowledge of processes of procedures to confirm findings and analyses unique scenarios to determine solutions for more complex issues.
Role-Specific Responsibilities
Trade life-cycle management - using systematic tools to capture executed trades (i.e Equity, Fixed Income, FX, and derivatives products) from the clients and communicate/confirm this activity to the 'street': custodians, brokers, and other interested parties
Research exceptions to ensure all activity is accurately processed and delivered by market deadlines
Trade settlement - analyze failed trades and work with all parties to quickly resolve trade settlement issues
with clients as their investment strategies shift and internally to increase efficiency and decrease risk
Management of reference & static data
Standard Job Responsibilities
Middle Office - S2Under minimal supervision, provides accounting and trading support activities for funds of moderate complexity. Performs reviews of moderately complex documents processed from across the Bank to confirm compliance with established processes and procedures. Under minimal supervision, performs moderately complex functions supporting accounting, trading and client services activities including book-keeping and data review. Reviews moderate volume of documents to ensure processors followed established procedures and took on minimal risk. Leverages some knowledge of processes of procedures to confirm findings. Tracks fund data and trades. Maintains records of moderate complexity in accordance with department policies and procedures. Provides requested data to team members. Searches for fail points in processes and drafts error reports to be provided to clients. Has some knowledge of compliance rules and service level agreements. Escalates external errors. Correction of internal errors is at the discretion of the client. Uses some knowledge of what constitutes an exception to review and identify exceptions in documentation. Confirms findings with more senior team members. If exceptions are found, checks against review guidelines to see if internal and client procedures were followed. Prepares system-generated reports or templates and conducts general data validation and reconciliation. Reviews work of junior team members. No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced Middle Office support staff, as needed. Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.
Qualifications
High school/secondary school or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Bachelor's degree a preferred (Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics), Mutual fund industry background is a plus.
1-2 years of total work experience preferred.. Experience in accounting support or the mutual fund industry preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Intermediate to advanced understanding of Excel.
High level of communication skills.
Remain organized and be able to handle multiple priorities
Work independently but also be a helpful teammate.
Comfortable asking questions to gain understanding on any area where understanding is limited.
Research, Reporting and Reconciliation


For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Job_Description:
Overview
Who we are
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of Dec. 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $46.7 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $2.4 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.
BNY Mellon Marketing & Communications
It’s an exciting time to join the BNY Mellon Marketing & Communications team. Our team is focused on delivering brand recognition, growth, increased client loyalty and employee engagement. We are a world-class, integrated marketing and communications organization, aligned around the needs our clients and the industry .
Role description
BNY Mellon is seeking a Global Communications Manager, who will be responsible for the development and implementation of strategic client communications to support overall strategy of the firm, spanning across regions and business lines.This individual will collaborate with stakeholders across the enterprise to manage the development and execution of communication plans in support of BNY Mellon’s key strategic corporate objectives, including business change, regulatory initiatives and individual line of business communications. Leveraging our global communications best practices, this individual will play a critical role in supporting client retention through providing clear and compelling communications to internal and external audiences designed to elevate the overall client experience.
Key responsibilities
Manage client communication assets from inception through execution, including development of key messaging, driving communications processes and governance, securing approvals and distribution to targeted audiences
Liaise with lines of business stakeholders to develop communications regarding operational updates, policy/procedural updates, product/service updates, corporate announcements, regulatory and change communications and more
Develop and implement strategic client communications plans to support critical client-impacting initiatives, regulatory change programs and strategic business change
Provide communications consultancy, advising on optimal client outreach strategies, distribution channel management and other tactics
Master digital tools to prepare and distribute internal and external communications to targeted audiences
Liaise with various internal teams to contribute to and/or assist in the establishment of internal/external resource sites

Qualifications

Impeccable written and oral communication skills
Strong editorial background and proofreading skills, adhering to established best practices and technical style guides
Effective networking skills and ability to cultivate collaborative partnerships with cross-functional teams, as well as senior-level management
Solid project management skills, leading communications initiatives and taking full accountability for communications deliverables and project workstreams supporting business lines and regulatory/change programs
Focused commitment to elevating overall client experience through thoughtful engagement strategies and compelling communications
Demonstrated experience with formal internal and external business communications, including FAQs, talking points, presentations, newsletters, etc.
Flexible approach to duties and scope of delivery is essential, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines, supporting individual business lines as well as global enterprise-wide initiatives
Ability to proactively identify obstacles and recommend solutions, particularly within the context of a global, matrix financial services firm with multiple client touchpoints
Demonstrated track record in developing and executing client communications strategies to internal and external audiences across a variety of channels, including digital and social
Deep and broad business acumen; solid understanding of financial services industry a plus
Experience working in a global, matrixed organization and shared accountability in a cross-regional team environment
7-10 years of professional experience in corporate communications, preferably within the financial services industry
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of work experience required

#LI-Hybrid

This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

We are a world-class, integrated marketing and communications organization, aligned around the needs our clients and the industry.

Role description and opportunities
This Business Management role, reporting into the Chief Operating Officer, will be responsible for business planning & analysis in addition to a full range of business management activities. The successful candidate will be working in a team environment, possess attention to detail, a focus on quality, high energy, and flexibility in a fast-paced organization. This role will work and partner horizontally across Marketing & Communications.


Responsible for annual and quarterly planning, working closely with Marketing & Communications teams and business line stakeholders to understand business goals, priorities, and ROI. Partner closely with Data & Analytics team to review scorecards, tracking progress against set objectives. Develop regular business results reporting cadence to stakeholders.
Manage monthly and quarterly business review meetings, whereby managing reviews in alignment with priorities and OKRs.
Help manage strategic meeting agendas and follow-up actions, whereby helping contribute to the achievement of business goals and objectives.
Prepare presentations and meeting materials that help drive forward strategic initiatives designed to help further the goal of the Marketing & Communications function.
Responsible for special projects, process recommendations and rollouts, as identified.
Work with the Business Management team to help enforce policies, standards, and processes.
Together with COO, manage monthly Vendor Sourcing Council, partnering closely with Procurement, Finance, and members of the Marketing & Communications leadership team, identifying efficiencies across vendor portfolio.
Partner closely across the function as trusted advisor, and often collaborating with other COO, CAO, and Finance teams. Serve as a connection point across Marketing & Communications; business liaison for internal service providers, i.e., Finance, Technology, Audit Compliance, Procurement, Facilities, HR, etc.
Exercise autonomy in anticipating a diverse range of highly complex issues and troubleshooting these issues as they arise. Appropriately prioritize, address and/or identify the level of urgency and escalate, as required
A successful candidate should ideally have these qualifications
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Min of 7 - 10 years of experience in similar role, preferably financial services. Prior Consulting experience a plus. Bachelor’s degree preferred.
Experience in administration, planning & analysis, with prior marketing strategy and planning experience a plus
Prior experience in project management or applicable business or function and cost-effective budgetary responsibility.
Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Tact and good judgement in confidential situations and proven experience interacting with senior management
Strong relationship management skills
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint a must

Issuers of equity and debt securities, financial intermediaries and investors worldwide require innovative and efficient securities services. That’s why we provide American and global depositary receipt (DR) programs in partnership with leading companies from 50+ countries. It’s also why we are the world's leading corporate trust provider, servicing outstanding debt in countries around the globe.
The Treasury Services business within BNY Mellon services the payments, liquidity management and trade financing needs of our clients in the US and internationally, assisting them in their efforts to optimize cash flow, ensure adequate liquidity and manage risk - all essential components to their success. We deliver our solutions with a dedication to unsurpassed customer satisfaction, an approach that has continually earned us excellent customer service ratings.
The Client Service Director is a senior point of escalation to support large, complex external clients to resolve the most critical and complex day-to-day issues/inquiries and directs them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.


Resolves the most critical and complex or non-routine client issues or inquires, as needed.
Leads resolution of issues escalated by more junior team members.
Monitors client experience, service delivery, quality and product performance
Ensures all issues are resolved in a timely and efficient manner
Provides suggestions for efficiency improvement
Creates a consistent client experience
Local language speaker
Assists with requested changes that impact the client’s service model, technology or service requirements
Enables quicker identification of themes/global trends
Creates and provides Client Service Review Meetings
Has greater understanding of our products and clients needs
Works closely with the Relationship Manager and Client Support Officer to understand the unique needs and requirements of the client.
Helps to navigate our organization to engage the right partners for resolutions to complex inquiries or projects
Uses knowledge of client services best practices and BNY Mellon client needs to lead the team's development of process improvements.
Supports multiple, and the most complex client accounts whose partnership with BNY Mellon may have a broad & significant impact on the business.


In this role you will gain broader knowledge of the Company and subject matter expertise in Treasury Services products. You will build a network of peers/partners within our Operations teams, and gain experience working directly with our clients and industry partners. We’re a client service orientated team seeking a client focused and organized new member who can work under pressure, can manage their day independently and is eager to learn and grow.


High school/secondary school or the equivalent combination of education experience is required
10+ years of total work experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required

Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description: Data Management and Quantitative Analysis - S3Under minimal supervision, compiles, synthesizes and reports on the Banks or market data sources. Provides support with access, maintenance and security activities. May manage moderately complex databases, feeds, etc. and assists with data sources. Conducts preliminary, basic calculations for more senior colleagues and helps develop reports. With minimal guidance, supports day-to-day data management activities. Monitors data feeds and performs data scrubbing for the Data Management and Quantitative Analysis team. Identifies and documents violations, exceptions, or occurrences exceeding tolerance thresholds. Adds and maintains data on the Banks systems, inputs and verifies accuracy of information. Reviews information entered by more junior team members. May test software enhancements and upgrades as necessary. Monitors moderately complex databases and spreadsheets. Performs basic calculations, initiates the execution of data modeling programs and prepares initial drafts of simple charts, graphs or reports.Provides information based on data-related questions from internal and external clients and may help provide solutions. Ensures that all customer responses are thoroughly documented and verified. No direct reports. May provide guidance to more junior roles. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience. 2-3 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in the financial industry preferred..
