Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
What You'll Do:
Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing), along with approximately 350 other applications used by the following high-priority business services and their clients.
The CMIST Centers of Excellence govern best practices across the organization. Supporting functions include financial planning, portfolio / program / project management, technology risk management, as well as communications and employee engagement. The teams also provide strategic guidance for enterprise technology programs for application resiliency and infrastructure modernization. In addition, the COEs are responsible for production application administration and incident management, as well as mainframe development and quality engineering standards.

Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Overview

Markets division overview:
For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.
BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers


Our team provides a distinct expertise in trade execution as one of the world’s largest asset managers and has the reputation as a trusted partner given our full suite of capital markets, financing and custody solutions. Execution Services is a division of BNY Mellon that provides global multi-asset trading and execution related services to buyside clients. The team currently trades on behalf of $650b of our internal asset management AUM across equities, fixed income, derivatives and FX. Later this year, Execution Services will be offering this holistic trading solution to external clients as an outsourced service. Outsourcing Trading allows clients to benefit from our investment, experience and expertise in trading while they focus on their portfolio management and analytical core competencies.


This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career professional to join our team. Key responsibilities for this role include:
Provide assistance to traders with portfolio order execution.
Liaise with trade support, middle office and back office teams, across the entire life cycle of an order.
Help resolve issues in order placement, matching and settlement.
Provide corrections to order details, based on input from brokers, traders and middle office staff.
May execute smaller or less complex trades and negotiate pricing for transactions.
Assist the trading and management across all administrative functions including reporting.
Execute all correspondence requisites with a basic understanding of the underlying business and specific client needs.
Complete assigned research assignments for the Trading function.
Handle routine client inquires and run reports as necessary.
Provide market color, trade information, security-related information to traders and portfolio managers.
No direct reports.


Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
0-3 years of total work experience preferred.
Experience in trading or brokerage preferred.
Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.

Job description:
Works with external clients to resolve moderately complex day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Supports clients in addressing moderately complex operational and technical issues and ensuring requests are executed.
Applies intermediate problem solving skills, experience and judgement to analyze information.
Uses communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides clients information related to BNY Mellon Corporate Trust Conventional Debt Public Not For Profit products and services representing multiple lines of business and geographies and directs them to the appropriate resources, as needed.

Issuers of equity and debt securities, financial intermediaries and investors worldwide require innovative and efficient securities services. That's why we provide American and global depositary receipt (DR) programs in partnership with leading companies from 50+ countries. It's also why we are the world's leading corporate trust provider, servicing outstanding debt in countries around the globe.


The Treasury Services business with BNY Mellon services the payments, liquidity management and trade financing needs of our clients in the US and internationally, assisting them in their efforts to optimize cash flow, ensure adequate liquidity and manager risk - all essential components to their success.
Today, we are a recognized leader, influencing the industry, assisting our client through changes in our environment and guiding them toward new technologies that will lay the foundation for their long-term success, while also meeting their very real need to continue to use the proven solutions they have traditionally relied upon. We continue to strive to bring faster processes, simpler interactions, actionable data and insights into what rapidly evolving digital solutions promise to deliver in the future. And, while we are committed to the digital transformation of our industry, we also want our clients to know that we are balancing the enthusiasm with a continued focus on providing the stability and reliability they have come to expect from us. We deliver our solutions with a dedication to unsurpassed customer satisfaction, an approach that has continually earned us excellent customer service ratings.
The Client Service Team directly assists external clients in the LatAm Region to resolve complex day-to-day issues and guide them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.


Support LatAm clients in addressing and resolving complex operational and technical issues and ensuring requests are executed by having advanced problem-solving skills, judgement, and experience to analyze information.

Use a CRM platform for all communication with clients.

Maybe the central point of contact for business development and assume client onboarding and/or risk management responsibilities.
Uses in-depth knowledge of client issues and needs to contribute to business development efforts.
Lead and participate in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience. Helps develop process improvements.


Fluent in speaking, writing and communicating in Spanish is required. Communicating in Portuguese is preferred.
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
3-7 years of total work experience preferred.


In this role you will gain general knowledge of the financial services industry, and subject matter expertise in Treasury Services products and services. What we do:
BNY Mellon’s Pershing has supported many of the world’s most sophisticated and successful financial services firms for more than 80 years. Wealth and institutional firms rely on us for clearing and custody, trading and settlement services, a broad suite of investment solutions, middle and back office support, data insights, and business consulting. BNY Mellon’s Pershing offers both Wealth Solutions for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors (RIA) and trust company clients, and Institutional Solutions for prime brokers and institutional broker-dealers.
Pershing LLC (member FINRA, NYSE, SIPC) is a BNY Mellon company. With offices around the world, Pershing has over $2 trillion in assets and millions of investor accounts. Pershing affiliates include Albridge Solutions, Inc., Lockwood Advisors, Inc., an investment adviser registered in the United States under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, and Pershing Limited. Additional information is available on pershing.com, or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter @Pershing.
BNY Mellon | Pershing’s Institutional Solutions team focuses on bringing the most stable and trusted global clearing infrastructure in the marketplace to Broker-Dealers, Investment Banks, Hedge Funds and Asset Managers. Our credit rating, strong balance sheet, high-touch client service and market-leading business services enable us to deliver flexible solutions for clearing, financing, securities lending and collateral management. These capabilities have allowed us to continually anticipate and meet the evolving needs of our clients, giving them the freedom to focus their talent and resources on optimizing and growing their businesses.

Account Management - Oversees assigned client accounts, ensuring satisfaction, swift response to client needs, efficient problem resolution, contract and operational compliance, risk mitigation and KYC responsibilities. Consults with clients on best practices, solutions and regulatory changes to support client engagement. Assigned accounts are typically core, moderately-sized accounts of limited complexity but may span multiple products. Incumbents are building breadth of knowledge on the firms products/services and are gaining exposure to more complex client accounts and issues. Incumbent may provide guidance to more junior Account Managers. Proactively consults core, moderately-sized client accounts, ensuring continued client satisfaction and listening for cues on client needs. Advises clients on best practices, organizational solutions and regulatory changes. Tracks and reports on client metrics. Contributes to the identification and development of appropriate metrics. Acts as day-to-day point of contact for the client. Provide support to Relationship Management function to enhance the account strategy. Keeps abreast of client account activity occurring throughout the firm. Liaises with relevant operations contacts (internally and externally) to coordinate service to the client. Escalates relevant issues to senior team members or management. Apply high client service protocols to support client satisfaction. Directly manages client inquiries and resolves problems within scope of knowledge. Broadens understanding of the business environment of assigned clients, industry trends and competitor services/offerings. May have people management responsibilities in some geographies. Provides guidance to less experienced Account Managers as needed. Responsibilities are primarily limited to own client accounts, however will contribute to the achievement of any team or area objectives. Focus is on core or moderately-sized accounts that are minimally complex. May provide secondary support on a large or key account under the guidance of a more senior Account Manager.
Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.5-7 years of total work experience preferred. Experience in Account Management or Client Service Delivery preferred.

What You'll Be Doing:
Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing), along with approximately 350 other applications used by the following high-priority business services and their clients.
The CMIST Centers of Excellence govern best practices across the organization. Supporting functions include financial planning, portfolio / program / project management, technology risk management, as well as communications and employee engagement. The teams also provide strategic guidance for enterprise technology programs for application resiliency and infrastructure modernization. In addition, the COEs are responsible for production application administration and incident management, as well as mainframe development and quality engineering standards.

BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.
BNY Mellon Risk and Compliance – Office of Regulatory Relations:
Risk and Compliance oversees risk services across all BNY Mellon businesses. Risk management ensures new business risks are reviewed and approved, while Compliance maintains processes compliant with applicable laws, regulations, policies and ethics.
The Office of Regulatory Relations (ORR) is responsible for developing and coordinating the company-wide strategy and approach to major regulatory supervisory matters. The function centrally manages BNY Mellon’s relationships and interactions with supervisory regulators, partnering with all business and functions across the company.


Leads and supports a wide array of activities associated with global regulatory interactions within the ORR’s Reporting and Systems function. This includes end-to-end project management related to system enhancements, analysis and reporting, special projects and other internal/external stakeholder processes. Ensures all systems used to capture regulatory interactions are updated and accurate, while continually problem-solving/streamlining processes as requirements change. Contributes to development of new processes or procedures for required analytics. Compiles, synthesizes, and reports on BNY Mellon’s regulatory interactions and related data, including regular and ad hoc reporting. Assists with access, maintenance, and security activities for BNY Mellon and regulatory systems; and further leads the ongoing development and implementation related to these systems. Reports and escalates progress/issues to management. Proactively identifies obstacles, opportunities and recommends solutions. Cultivates collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


Supports day-to day data management activities related to regulatory requests, findings and reporting
Manages the ORR’s systems and data including performing reconciliations, reporting, and participating in business continuity/disaster readiness testing
Creates and/or compiles standard and ad hoc reporting for senior management committees, internal stakeholders, and the Board of Directors
Identifies, develops recommendations for, and implements enhancements to systems, reporting, and processes
Develops relationships with internal and external stakeholders
A successful candidate should ideally have these qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or equivalent combination of education and experience required, MBA preferred
6-8 years of experience in financial services or business partner function preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Skilled in Excel, including pivot tables, functions (including VLOOKUP, CHOOSE, MATCH, SUMPRODUCT and logical functions), error handling, working with arrays, VBA, charts and graphs
Proficient in PowerPoint skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines
Project management experience is preferred
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is preferred

Overview
Who we are

BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of March 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $41.7 trillion in assets under custody/or administration, and $2.2 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand for The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available at www.bnymellon.com. Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.

What we do

As one of the nation's leading wealth managers, BNY Mellon Wealth Management is dedicated to helping individuals, families, planned giving programs, endowments, foundations, and other institutions with all their wealth and investment planning needs. By providing integrated products, services, and solutions, we help them capitalize on opportunity while managing risk. Backed by more than two centuries of experience, we understand our clients' needs and deliver customized strategies to help them reach their goals.

Job_Description:
What You'll Be Doing:
Clearing, Markets & Issuer Services Technology (CMIST) is responsible for application development and support for critical business systems including Repo Edge (collateral management), Enterprise Payment Hub (multi-currency payment processing), and Broker Dealer Clearance (securities clearing), along with approximately 350 other applications used by the following high-priority business services and their clients.
The CMIST Centers of Excellence govern best practices across the organization. Supporting functions include financial planning, portfolio / program / project management, technology risk management, as well as communications and employee engagement. The teams also provide strategic guidance for enterprise technology programs for application resiliency and infrastructure modernization. In addition, the COEs are responsible for production application administration and incident management, as well as mainframe development and quality engineering standards.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Overview
Who We Are
For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.
BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers
What We Do
Enterprise Change Resiliency Office Overview (ECRO)
The ECRO for BNY Mellon, a first-line enterprise-wide office, which leads the firm’s change management and resiliency functions.
Enterprise Change Office Overview (ECO)
In order to strengthen an enterprise-wide approach to Program Delivery and establish a scalable resilient operating model that builds delivery capabilities across Technology, Operations, the lines of business and support functions, BNY Mellon has evolved how we deliver programs of change across the bank. As part of this strategy, a new ECO has been created to provide central oversight, governance, and strategic execution. The ECO establishes policy and performs a governance function with select enterprise program delivery accountability founded on a federated model that partners with the program delivery teams from Technology, Operations, the lines of business and other functional areas across the organization.

Role Overview
This role, under the direction of the Program Manager, will serve as the bridge between Technology, Operations and Business stakeholders in analyzing and evaluating business processes and translating into strategic solutions, business requirements and user stories. Additionally, the candidate will interact with cross-functional teams to lead projects and workstreams to successful completion. The candidate will have the ability to effectively communicate and distill complex processes into meaningful requirements to define technology solutions and to directly manage project scope, schedule, and resources. An understanding of Agile project management and experience in working with multiple stakeholder groups to analyze and capture their needs is preferred for this role.

Role-Specific Job Responsibilities
Influences and leads change within the project, team, department, and across multiple departments. This includes changes to processes, technology/systems, job roles, organizational/project structures and developing change strategies to maximize adoption/usage and minimize resistance.


Jira management
SharePoint/Confluence management
Schedules and facilitates project meetings and provide minutes and action items to attendees
PMO documentation
Metrics and reporting
Develops and maintains detailed project plan with input from all the accountable stakeholders
Maintains a log of risks and issues and follows up on the action items coming from meetings
Builds cross functional and cross department relationships.
Develops business cases and presents project information to senior leadership to facilitate effective and efficient decision making.
Develops and explicitly communicates the products’ goal.


Requirements gathering and writing
Prioritization of requirements
Ensures backlog is transparent, visible and understood
Aligns stakeholders and analysts to assist in the above points
Drives creation of acceptance criteria and each teams’ definition of done
Ensures all aspects of a body of work are complete, through testing, defect management, to release.
Serves as primary point of contact for the program to non-ECO resources.
Serves as a coach for program members.
Removes impediments for program resources.
Removes barriers between stakeholders and working teams.
Helps establish empirical product planning in complex environments.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required; advanced degree is preferred.
8 - 10 years of related program and/or project management experience required
Consulting experience with Senior IT and Business Management is preferred.
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Preferred Qualifications
Advanced skills in project management (particularly Agile and Hybrid environments) and business analysis with the ability to play multiple roles simultaneously and/or seamlessly transition between roles as needed.
Ability to work with difficult stakeholders and bring consensus to disparate people.
Ability to meet and engage new stakeholders and individuals.
Proficiency in Jira and Confluence.
Superior communication, time management and organizational skills.
Ability to anticipate, resolve, organize, prioritize, and escalate critical issues as needed.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Job Overview:
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. The job holder leads the technical design, development and documentation of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. S/he analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, and logical processes and interfaces with other systems. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation. Must have thorough and demonstrative knowledge on or both the user-side frontend of a website, as well as the backend, server-side that powers the user-side. Additional requirements include intermediate understanding of security principles, relational databases and architecture design principles. Programming well-designed, testable, efficient code. Analyze, design and develop tests and test-automation suites. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and solutions. Maintain software functionality and currency (technical debt and gain). Actively participate in code reviews. Integrate software components into a fully functional software system. Apply security and privacy principles. Execute full lifecycle software development. Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures. Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems. Ensure software is updated with latest features. Participate in deployment process following all change controls. Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms. Provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Active learning engagement. Complete all required mandatory training / policy awareness curricula on time. Use learning tools such as Pluralsight to complete both recommended and aspirational targets set in personal development plans. Demonstrate team work. Leverage existing products/functionality and promote reuse. Work alongside other engineers on the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices. Collaborate closely with all the other members of the team to take shared responsibility for the overall efforts that the team has committed to. Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, business users, project managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions. Utilize local meetups to gain and share knowledge. Compiles documentation written by more senior developers of all procedures used in system. Acts as mentor to junior level engineers. Prior experience with using a specific application development toolkit and knowledge of front end and backend development coding languages such as C#, Java, HTML, NodeJS, CSS, JSON, Angular, JavaScript. Must also have proficiency in Core Spring, ANSI, Docker. Communications and organization skills; team work skills. N/A. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Who we are:
As a global investments company, BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Every day, our Technology employees make this happen while also seeking out new ways to do it more efficiently and effectively.
As part of BNY Mellon’s global Technology organization, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with some of the best and brightest, technology, business, and financial minds to find new and better ways to exceed our clients’ expectations and build the future of financial services. With more than 230 years of industry leading experience under our belts, you might even say that we are the original fintech.
At BNY Mellon, cybersecurity is a top priority for both technology and the business. The members of the Information Security Division are on constant alert, using their creativity and knowledge of cybersecurity, technology and business processes to develop and deliver creative solutions. In this fast-paced environment, staff collaborate to respond to current risks, while identifying and anticipating future threats. Our cyber capabilities encompass the full spectrum of services from Cyber Operations (SOC, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, Cyber Incident Response, Penetration Testing & Red Teaming, Cyber Analytics & Fraud, and Insider threat) to Cyber Architecture and Engineering (Network, Platform, Cloud, and Applications Security). Together with the CISO and his leadership team, staff provide a robust set of cyber services that provide full scope protection and response capabilities across the BNY Mellon enterprise. We help our businesses, the bank’s executive team, and our board of directors understand cybersecurity risk and the steps that must be taken to create and maintain a secure environment that drives innovation.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Overview Sr. Specialist User Experience - >
We are actively seeking an energetic and innovative UX Designer to join our group. The Visual Designer (VD) role is an integral part of the team. BNY Mellon IMT is embarking on a transformation into the user experience by incorporating strong Product and Design discipline into the work and services we create.
Create and evolve the visual design language for the products we work on while maintaining awareness of the larger ecosystem of product and design standards.

The products we design must add value while adding minimal complexity. To do our job well, we utilize creative design-led techniques to help us break through the industry jargon and bureaucracy and find insights that others can’t. We elevate UX not just to solve users’ problems but also to use design to steer the product’s evolution into a powerful and extensible framework. You’ll support our client-first mindset to drive efficiency and effectiveness. The successful candidate will join this unique and specialized team that provides clean product design and delivery through the tech team. Working in a professional capacity as a visual designer on highly interactive and data rich applications.

Who We Are
UX Center of Excellence (UX CoE) is part of BNY Mellon Investment Management. Our goal is to improve the User Experience for advisors and customers, ushering in the future tools of Investment Management. Adapting the Lean UX principles, we work closely with teams to shorten the feedback loop and learn from every iteration.

For over 230 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $15 billion in revenues and market capitalization of approximately $50 billion.

About You
Expert at User-centric design approach that involves rapid testing and iteration of designs
You can think through user pain points, find reasonable solutions, mock them up and spec it in detail, and work with engineers to build them
Expert in iconography and building them from scratch
Enjoys the multi-disciplinary and collaborative nature of product development (SDLC)
Detail-oriented and you have a problem-solving mindset
Experience with agile and lean UX methodology and deliverables
Can confidently translate business problems and requirements into compelling wireframes
Experience working in a cross-functional organization, achieving goals through partnership and collaboration (Building relationships with stakeholders)
Ability to work in ambiguity and draw insights from broad data sources
You stay up to date on the industrial latest UX design trends
Strong presentation and communication skills, critical creative thinker and excellent work quality
Be an exceptional multi-tasker who’s quick and organized
Required Qualifications
Minimum (5) years of experience required
Portfolio must be available for review
Expert user of Figma, Sketch, Invision, Axure RP, Jira, Adobe Creative Suite
Design for mobile devices (native and web mobile applications) iOS and Android
Responsive Design for web applications and Branding building a design system
Experience hands-on research, wireframing, prototyping, user personas, journey maps, story maps and user stories at an interactive agency or design studio.
Bachelor's degree in psychology, user experience, computer science, design, human computer interaction, related discipline, or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated ability to work and manage multiple priorities on concurrent, rigorous deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment.
Knowledge of Accessibility / ADA compliance is a plus
Building short animation clips is a plus
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers

Our Team
Global Operations & Technology (GOT) provides scalable and resilient solutions across BNY Mellon’s Businesses, Technology and Operations by driving scale, agility and client-centric teams. GOT leverages technology platforms and applications that support BNY Mellon’s role as the leading provider of solutions to the financial markets, while ensuring seamless delivery through best-in-class operational delivery.
GOT Management & Strategy is the engine that delivers competitive advantage by optimizing how we run GOT. GOT S&G defines the GOT strategy, plans the portfolio, re-engineers business processes, oversees regulatory functions, navigates technology change, governs leadership planning and engagement, develops key data and tools, strategically partners with key vendors, and leads special projects focused on creating client focus in GOT.

Reporting into the Head of Investment Risk Analytics, the Investment Data Specialist will be integral part of the newly created CRO Investment Risk’s team. The Investment Risk Management team has Risk oversight of all investment management activity across the company, executing on our goal of full triangulation of risk management, providing dedicated senior risk coverage of our Investment Management business and other investment activities.
Position Summary
Facilitate the creation and management of a central Investment risk analysis and reporting platform to aggregate risk, performance and liquidity metrics data in a timely, transparent and consistent framework for a large investment management complex
Working within a risk analytics and data team, and cooperatively with risk technology and reporting groups, develop an in-depth understanding of available data sources and appropriately leverage internal systems, databases to build efficient, scalable platform to analyze and report on investment risk

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Overview
Our Team
Technology Services Group (TSG) powers BNY Mellon by providing scale, capacity, and capability to deliver the critical technology required to operate the global financial services markets.

TSG is defined by three core values:
Creative innovators, delivering excellence and simplicity
Always doing the right thing for the Bank, colleagues, and clients
Fostering a collaborative, diverse and inclusive environment, where we challenge each other to execute as one TSG team
As part of TSG, the Architecture & Engineering team
Defines enterprise technology and engineering principles and best practices.
Develops next-generation engineering solutions focused on Resiliency and Innovation .
Engineers and integrates the critical systems and platforms used across the Bank and with external Clients.

The Role
We are seeking Senior Collaboration Engineer to join our Workplace Technology Team. You will be a key member of our global team for all end user collaboration for the Bank. You will be responsible for designing the underlying architecture, evaluating existing market products, engineering and strategic deployment for Audio-Visual, Events, Web-Conferencing, Command Centers and Voice Services for the Bank.
Our Workplace Technology team is responsible for the strategy, engineering, and strategic deployment activities for all end user services, including voice, video, mobile services, Windows physical and virtual desktop, Mac, Microsoft 365, email, chat, collaboration, and related technologies. Our mission is to articulate the vision for employee productivity and collaboration for the Bank, selective innovative technologies to transform the end user experience.
If you are a technology evangelist with a passion to deliver technology solutions that differentiate BNY Mellon from its competitors, then this is the place for you.


Manage video conference, event, collaboration, and meeting space deployments at New York Headquarters.
Be accountable end to end for the service delivery of this space, including business case, service offerings and service quality.
Resolve engineering-level escalations of technical issues and disruptions minimizing impact on
talent and audience. Write up AAR reports detailing improvements based on learnings.
Work as part of the team to develop technology strategy and strategic deployment for existing
and future collaboration and meeting spaces, including huddle rooms, meeting rooms, collaboration rooms, boardrooms, auditoriums, command centers, TV quality broadcast studios
and similar.
Own and develop documentation to ensure solutions are operational, resilient, meeting end user needs.
Work to establish event checklists, operational playbooks, runbooks, and create technical
documentation to better map out incremental room improvements.
Maintain key vendor relationships; engage with external partners/agencies where needed to
leverage appropriate services and technology
Technical bench testing and evaluation of new tools to meet growing demands of our clients.
Develop best practices and playbooks around technical operation of key Event Technologies.
Work as a key member of a broader team demonstrating ownership, expertise, and customer
service to the bank.
Work closely with internal stake holders and external vendors to ensure deadlines are met and
ensure clients are trained in the operation of new equipment.


Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required; advanced degree preferred.10-12 years of related experience required; experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Who we are :
As a global investments company, BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Every day, our Technology employees make this happen while also seeking out new ways to do it more efficiently and effectively.
As part of BNY Mellon’s global Technology organization, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with some of the best and brightest, technology, business, and financial minds to find new and better ways to exceed our clients’ expectations and build the future of financial services. With more than 230 years of industry leading experience under our belts, you might even say that we are the original fintech.
At BNY Mellon, cybersecurity is a top priority for both technology and the business. The members of the Information Security Division are on constant alert, using their creativity and knowledge of cybersecurity, technology and business processes to develop and deliver creative solutions. In this fast-paced environment, staff collaborate to respond to current risks, while identifying and anticipating future threats. Our cyber capabilities encompass the full spectrum of services from Cyber Operations (SOC, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, Cyber Incident Response, Penetration Testing & Red Teaming, Cyber Analytics & Fraud, and Insider threat) to Cyber Architecture and Engineering (Network, Platform, Cloud, and Applications Security). Together with the CISO and his leadership team, staff provide a robust set of cyber services that provide full scope protection and response capabilities across the BNY Mellon enterprise. We help our businesses, the bank’s executive team, and our board of directors understand cybersecurity risk and the steps that must be taken to create and maintain a secure environment that drives innovation.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Pershing X is a new start-up unit to incubate, engineer and deliver breakthrough solutions that will transform the advisory market.
Pershing X will deliver the industry’s leading end-to-end advisory platform, helping financial service firms solve the challenge of managing multiple and disconnected technology tools and data sets for their advisors and fueling our clients’ business growth.
We are a collaborative and fast-growing team working on exciting and innovative digital product offerings.
Summary:
The Senior Specialist, (Production Services, Application Support) maintains and supports moderately complex applications and their operating environments. Performs complex troubleshooting as a subject matter expert in one or more applications. Works to ensure appropriate monitoring and alerting setup. Leads root cause analysis and problem management for complex problems to address underlying technical issues. Collaborates with business and application development stakeholders. Lead production readiness reviews for new releases and validate changes during production implementation. Monitors changes to applications and their operating environment. Analyzes any complex issues. Recommends technical solutions on application problems. Reviews and develops updates of contingency documentation and processes. Performs periodic tests of disaster recovery processes. Reviews and analyzes product migrations through all systems environments. May review and execute Change Management scripts. Leads major incident management calls for resolution of high priority incidents. May mentor or provide guidance for junior team members.

Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Job Description
Quality Engineer will inject Quality at each and every step of the SDLC. Will help solve complex automation problems spanning multiple technologies. Will play a key role in Shifting Left and enable CI/CD Pipelines. Will also help with constantly improving the efficiency of the Automation Processes. Attends the required Product Backlog Grooming & Planning Meetings to contribute to the Creation of Effective User Stories. Comes up with comprehensive Regression Suites for Applications & Systems. Solves Complex Automation Challenges spanning multiple technologies in a scalable & extensible manner with least amount of maintenance. Identifies potential risks to the project delivery and escalates them to the Senior QE management so that the team can make the appropriate course correction to meet the timelines. Helps resolves issues detected during testing. Provides QE support to Development, Business and Test teams on internal and external issues. Helps with getting down to the Root Cause of the Issues and works with the Engineering Teams to resolve and Validate the Fixes. Ensures Engineering Teams are adhering to all the Quality Controls in place. Also validates the complete traceability to the Requirements enabling the teams to be Audit Ready. Continuously improves the Efficiency of the Automation using innovative technologies & thought process/Enables Continuous Testing, Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery for the Apps Automated.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Full Stack Systems Engineers
Job_Description:
Pershing X is a new start-up unit to incubate, engineer and deliver breakthrough solutions that will transform the advisory market. Pershing X will deliver the industry’s leading end-to-end advisory platform, helping financial service firms solve the challenge of managing multiple and disconnected technology tools with data sets for their advisors that fuel our clients’ business growth. We are a collaborative and fast-growing team working on innovative digital product offerings.
Product Management - Works independently to manage a range of moderately complex products from development to sales and delivery. Products can be domestic, regional, or global in nature. Supports more experienced colleagues with relevant competitive, market and/or financial analyses to gain breadth/depth of knowledge in relevant products, services and platforms. Develops ideas for product enhancements and/or expansion to other regions/lines of business based on the risk and regulatory environment surrounding the products under development. Coordinates the management, development, and enhancement of products in order to meet operating plan financials assigned to products profitability goals by pricing, developing, selling, and analyzing customer sales trends. Includes collaboration with Operations, Technology, Risk, Compliance, Legal, etc. as part of new product development, enhancement, delivery, strategy, and planning. Employs a client-focused, strategic approach to develop the business case for firm offerings in the marketplace through in-depth analyses on client segments, competitive landscape and industry environment. Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of assigned products, the marketplace and client needs to drive product growth/development and maximize profitability across varying stages of their life cycle. Researches and supports product profitability by pricing for the assigned product or product line in order to achieve operating plan revenue goals. Performs ad-hoc competitive analyzes, market research, and regulatory research. Performs technical training, demonstration and develops user guides for clients while also preparing sales materials and training BNY Mellon professionals. Guides junior product managers and directs efforts of operations and systems managers as they implement systems and processes for clients and ensures compliance measures are followed. No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced colleagues as needed. Contributes to the achievement of multiple related teams objectives and profitability of assigned product(s).

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: Collaboration Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview
Company Overview
BNY Mellon empowers individuals and institutions to succeed in the global economy providing investment management, investment services and wealth management. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). With a dedicated business presence on six continents and in 35 countries, BNY Mellon delivers global scale at the local level. The Global Delivery Centre in Wroclaw is a growing location, predominately providing support services to BNY Mellon entities in the areas of fund accounting and investment operations.
Organizational Overview
Issuer Services New Product and Innovation Team delivers innovative, best in class shared solutions to BNY Mellon’s clients and businesses in Issuer Services Loan programs. Our platforms, frameworks, and operational business services accelerate delivery and elevate the Bank’s business capabilities. We embrace Agile and Open-Source technologies.


Java, Spring, Spring Integration, Spring Boot
Angular, Bootstrap, Angular Material, JavaScript, CSS
Oracle, Denodo, Apache Kudu
Private cloud infrastructure, GitLab CICD
GitLab
IntelliJ, JIRA, Confluence
Scrum
Who are we looking for?
Passionate Java and Angular developers with team-oriented mindsets
Highly motivated self-starters who are comfortable leaving their comfort zones and thinking creatively
Inquisitive engineers with strong problem solving, analysis, troubleshooting, and communication skills
Strong technologists with a preference towards developing their technical skills in cloud and microservices-oriented architectures

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Privilege Access Management (PAM) Engineer
Job_Description:
Who we are :
As a global investments company, BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. Every day, our Technology employees make this happen while also seeking out new ways to do it more efficiently and effectively.
As part of BNY Mellon’s global Technology organization, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with some of the best and brightest, technology, business, and financial minds to find new and better ways to exceed our clients’ expectations and build the future of financial services. With more than 230 years of industry leading experience under our belts, you might even say that we are the original fintech.
At BNY Mellon, cybersecurity is a top priority for both technology and the business. The members of the Information Security Division are on constant alert, using their creativity and knowledge of cybersecurity, technology and business processes to develop and deliver creative solutions. In this fast-paced environment, staff collaborate to respond to current risks, while identifying and anticipating future threats. Our cyber capabilities encompass the full spectrum of services from Cyber Operations (SOC, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, Cyber Incident Response, Penetration Testing & Red Teaming, Cyber Analytics & Fraud, and Insider threat) to Cyber Architecture and Engineering (Network, Platform, Cloud, and Applications Security). Together with the CISO and his leadership team, staff provide a robust set of cyber services that provide full scope protection and response capabilities across the BNY Mellon enterprise. We help our businesses, the bank’s executive team, and our board of directors understand cybersecurity risk and the steps that must be taken to create and maintain a secure environment that drives innovation.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: Specialist, Production Services Application Support
Job_Description:
Overview

Who we are:
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of March 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $41.7 trillion in assets under custody/or administration, and $2.2 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments.
BNY Mellon is the corporate brand for The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available at www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.

What we do:
BNY Mellon's Asset Servicing business is dedicated to dynamically supporting our clients' investments and safeguarding their assets, keeping them working around the clock and across the world. It's part of our commitment to being a true partner for our clients' investment success. We specialize in operational solutions and capabilities for today's market-enhancing management and administration of investments with services that process, monitor and measure investment data from around the world. By leveraging BNY Mellon's global footprint and deep expertise, we deliver insight-driven solutions for every phase of investing.


The Specialist, Business Planning and Analysis is part of Client Service Solutions responsible for supporting the Client Service Delivery functions across a wide range of “all risk” incident management, client change and client experience initiatives. The individual will perform daily monitoring of operational stability with specific focus on anything with a client impact. From detection, assessment, notification and reporting of client impacting events, the role provides a key point of contact for alerts, escalations, cascade and data management of client impacting events. Also this role will be responsible for managing Client Facing projects (tactical and strategic) where coordination with the client facing teams is required.


Support efforts to develop, maintain, assess, and improve client experience at BNYM through effective Incident Management, Client change initiatives, projects with a client impact
Support the Asset Servicing Resilience Strategy
Be the point of contact for partners in Technology, Resilience, Incident Management, Operations, Corporate Communications and Client Service Delivery before, during and after Incidents
Develop and improve processes within Client Service Solutions on the management and communication of incidents internally and externally
Support delivery and maintenance of business continuity plans
Partner with technology to coordinate business participation in technology recovery exercises
Represent the business during real-time disruptions, and act as backup during crisis events which may occur during or after working hours
Custody and Asset Servicing background knowledge preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to effectively work with senior stakeholders within the business and draft and opine on corporate client communications
Strong project management skills, including the ability to work on simultaneous projects across multiple teams with short lead times


3 - 5 Years in custody or client facing roles
2 - 3 Years of business projects exposure in a regional or global workplace environment, within a Securities Servicing business
Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is preferred
Strong influencing skills, including ability to articulate complex issues and incorporate feedback
Microsoft applications (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, MS Project, and Word, Confluence, SharePoint.)
Self-motivated, proactive, and calm under pressure with the ability to deal with ambiguity and short deadlines
Willingness to learn, develop, and take on additional responsibilities when required

Title: Specialist, Production Services Application Support
Job_Description:
Overview

Who we are:
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of March 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $41.7 trillion in assets under custody/or administration, and $2.2 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments.

BNY Mellon is the corporate brand for The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available at www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.


The Markets group helps clients solve their trading, financing and liquidity needs through innovative solutions, services, market insights, industry expertise and scalable technology. We deliver foreign exchange execution, securities finance, equity and fixed income investment solutions and liquidity services.


The incumbent will support the Markets’ Business Sanctions Coordinator (BSC) function, including, but not limited to, the following:
Ensure Markets has written policies, procedures and controls reasonably designed to achieve compliance with BNYM’s financial crimes policies including Global Anti-Money Laundering (AML) / Know Your Customer (KYC) Policy and Economic Sanctions Policy.
Act as an escalation point of contact for sanctions matches and potential matches.
Provide support to ensure appropriate new product/business controls are in place including gap analysis.
Complete new and/or update Business-Specific Data Lineage and Risk Coverage Mapping Cards, as necessary present new and materially revised cards to Global Economic Sanctions Advisory Group.
Arrange for prompt distribution and communication of all economic sanctions related information and materials impacting Markets when received from the Global Compliance Division.
Act as a liaison between Markets and the Global Compliance and Legal Divisions, including providing the Legal Division and/or the Global Sanctions Compliance Officer with information necessary to properly respond to OFAC or other regulatory requests.
Maintain updated and current OFAC surveys.
Support a variety of AML related matters, including annual blocked property attestations, PEP reviews, DNDBW responses and FinCEN 314(a) requests, which have direct, but unique impacts across Markets.


Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or equivalent combination of education and experience required.
7-10 years of experience preferred.
Keen interest and background in Financial Crime and Regulatory related matters (e.g., Economic Sanctions, KYC, AML Surveillance, Anti-Bribery and Corruption, Anti-Tax Evasion, etc.).
Relevant knowledge of financial institutions including capital markets products and transactions preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, and an ability to be sensitive to the needs of stakeholders across the lines of business and our business partners.
Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.
Strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks/projects simultaneously.
Ability keep sensitive information confidential and know how to use appropriately.
Capable of identifying problems and working with more senior team members to begin to structure a solution or remedy to address issue(s).

Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of Dec. 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $46.7 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $2.4 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.

Job Summary:
Client Service - Works with external clients to resolve the most complex day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Leads team members in providing support to major clients in addressing and resolving complex operational and technical issues and ensuring requests are executed.
Applies advanced problem solving skills, judgement, and experience to analyze information.
Uses developed communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides key individuals at assigned clients information related to BNY Mellon's products and services representing a broad array of lines of business and geographies and leverages an in-depth understanding of broader BNY Mellon services and offerings.

No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced team members.
Supports multiple, complex client accounts.
Serve as a client service manager for our “Financial Institutional” clientele namely Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, Citibank as well as several well know Hedge and Private Equity Funds. I’m also looking for candidates with (IPA) experience and acting as a trustee for Debt issuances.
Trustee, paying agent service as well as domestic custody settlement with experience in DTCC and FRB (federal reserve bank). Some Global markets settlement is of interest as well.
Hybrid Work Schedule with 2 or 3 days in the office; flexible days of your choosing. Must be in at least two days as per BNYM’s “security service and digital requirement”. Work hours are New York hours 9am-6pm.


Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
5-7 years of total work experience preferred.
Experience in an operational area and/or client services preferred.
Experience with Corporate Trust (IPA) issuers paying agent, regulatory reporting or Custody settlement.

Title: Specialist, Production Services Application Support
Job_Description:
Pershing X is a new start-up unit to incubate, engineer and deliver breakthrough solutions that will transform the advisory market.
Pershing X will deliver the industry’s leading end-to-end advisory platform, helping financial service firms solve the challenge of managing multiple and disconnected technology tools and data sets for their advisors and fueling our clients’ business growth.
We are a collaborative and fast-growing team working on exciting and innovative digital product offerings.
Summary:
The Senior Specialist, (Production Services, Application Support) maintains and supports moderately complex applications and their operating environments. Performs complex troubleshooting as a subject matter expert in one or more applications. Works to ensure appropriate monitoring and alerting setup. Leads root cause analysis and problem management for complex problems to address underlying technical issues. Collaborates with business and application development stakeholders. Lead production readiness reviews for new releases and validate changes during production implementation. Monitors changes to applications and their operating environment. Analyzes any complex issues. Recommends technical solutions on application problems. Reviews and develops updates of contingency documentation and processes. Performs periodic tests of disaster recovery processes. Reviews and analyzes product migrations through all systems environments. May review and execute Change Management scripts. Leads major incident management calls for resolution of high priority incidents. May mentor or provide guidance for junior team members.

Overview
About BNY Mellon
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. BNY Mellon’s Pershing has supported many of the world’s most sophisticated and successful financial services firms for more than 80 years. Wealth and institutional firms rely on us for clearing and custody, trading and settlement services, a broad suite of investment solutions, middle and back-office support, data insights, and business consulting. BNY Mellon’s Pershing offers both Wealth Solutions for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors (RIA), wealth managers and trust company clients, and Institutional Solutions for prime brokers and institutional broker-dealers.
The Strategy team is responsible for (i) shaping the strategic dialogue within Pershing’s Executive Committee, (ii) analyzing and assessing industry trends as inputs to our strategy development process (iii) formulating strategies and securing investments to pursue growth opportunities, (iv) structuring partnerships and acquisitions to advance the growth strategy, and (v) socializing and building confidence in our strategy among key stakeholder groups. The function thrives on intellectual curiosity, intellectual honesty, challenging the status quo, and collaboration.


Conducting research and data analysis to inform business decisions and strategic evaluations
Developing analyses and recommendations that advance the company’s overall business strategy
Supporting the development of Pershing X, a newly established division that will provide all-encompassing Fintech solutions to the wealth management community
Supporting the execution of acquisitions and structuring of strategic partnerships
Articulating the company’s goals and priorities across multiple stakeholder groups to create transparency and confidence in the business strategy
Evaluating new growth opportunities and perform market entry assessments in wealth management, financial services infrastructure and financial technology sectors
Developing plans and frameworks to evaluate and analyze strategic hypotheses
Constructing forecasts and analytical models to quantify business opportunities
Supporting the execution of M&A transactions through market screening, target due diligence and financial evaluation
Monitoring and analyzing industry trends and market changes impacting the asset and wealth management industry
Developing competitive intelligence on broad scope of players in the asset and wealth management industry


Experience at a business consulting firm, strategy function or investor relationship within a financial services organization, or investment banking / transaction advisory role covering financial services
General knowledge of asset and wealth management industry, major players and client segments
Experience in market research and data analysis
Financial modelling experience
Analytical mind with problem-solving aptitude and ability to structure analyses
Ability to distil complex concepts in simple, practical terms
Bachelors degree in business or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required.5-7 years of related experience preferred. Experience in the securities or financial services industry preferred.

Title: Specialist, Production Services Application Support
Job_Description:
Overview

Who we are:
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of March 31, 2022, BNY Mellon had $45.5 trillion in assets under custody/or administration, and $2.3 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand for The Bank of New York Mellon
Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available a t www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom a t www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.


BNY Mellon | Pershing has supported many of the world’s most sophisticated and successful financial services firms for more than 80 years. Wealth and institutional firms rely on us for clearing and custody, trading and settlement services, a broad suite of investment solutions, middle and back office support, data insights, and business consulting. BNY Mellon’s Pershing offers both Wealth Solutions for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors (RIA) and trust company clients, and Institutional Solutions for prime brokers and institutional broker-dealers.
Pershing LLC (member FINRA, NYSE, SIPC) is a BNY Mellon company. With offices around the world, Pershing has over $2 trillion in assets and millions of investor accounts. Pershing affiliates include Albridge Solutions, Inc., a leading provider of enterprise data management solutions that deliver a single view of an investor’s broad range of assets and Lockwood Advisors, Inc., an investment adviser registered in the United States under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 and a leading provider of managed accounts solutions. Additional information is available on pershing.com, or follow us on LinkedIn or Twitter @Pershing.


BNY Mellon | Pershing’s Institutional Solutions team focuses on bringing the most stable and trusted global clearing infrastructure in the marketplace to Hedge Funds, Asset Managers, Broker-Dealers, and Investment Banks. As a key member of our Enhanced Services – Middle Office team, you will be responsible for coordinating all trade activity for assigned clients, including trade capture and once approved, trade communication with all the respective trade processing units. You will also gather all relevant data from Operations and prepare client reports, and assist Account Managers in providing client service.


Handle post-execution trade processing from trade entry through settlement for all products and markets. This includes trade capture, trade reconciliation, break communication and resolution, global and domestic fail monitoring, billing coordination, position pricing, account balancing, option expiration, new account opening, account maintenance, wire authentication, tri-party collateral reconciliation, Geneva Portfolio Accounting reconciliation, and other ad-hoc requests.
Interact with hedge fund and mutual fund clients, as well as internal account management, new client integration, trading, P&S, clearance, settlement, delivery management, corporate actions, dividends, security master, new accounts, securities lending, buy-ins, and prime brokerage operations.
Use your problem-solving skills, judgement, experience, and communication skills to help hedge funds and other institutional clients address and resolve complex operational and technical issues; ensure their requests are executed in a timely and high-quality manner.
Provide clients information related to BNY Mellon | Pershing's products and services; proactively assist clients in reviewing potential business needs and directing them to appropriate resources at our firm.
Apply your in-depth knowledge of client issues and needs to contribute to business development efforts; use your understanding of our products and services to best propose expanded offerings to clients for front office consideration.
Lead and participate in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience.
Develop and implement process improvements; contribute to overall team efficiency.


You will be able to contribute to the success of our Enhanced Service team by sharing your Middle Office knowledge and skills, servicing new clients, proposing expanded services to existing clients, and mentoring less experienced team members. You will also partner with colleagues across the broader Institutional Solutions team and BNY Mellon | Pershing enterprise to further augment your skills and build your network.


Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience
7-10 years of total work experience (preferred)
Experience in an operational area and/or client services (preferred)
Strong understanding of the Alternatives industry is a plus
FINRA Series 99 required; 7 preferred

Job_Description:
The Sr. Specialist, Business Analyst works closely with Operations Analysts and our clients’ to support service delivery through the D&A Content Hub and Eagle products that interface with a broad range of external vendors and BNYM Asset servicing platforms. The role provides process development and support for the business operations teams who are managing data quality, stewarding of job execution and workflows, data enrichment, and a wide variety of information delivery to client’s and their external partners.
The candidate will provide a business analyst role to support the technology used for data stewarding, data mgmt. and entitlement functions for the D&A content hub and Eagle products. S/he works collaboratively with analysts, product owners, developers, service managers, and operational teams as well as with a variety of teams within the BNY Mellon’s Asset Servicing business to clearly define systems, business, and functional requirements to support the design and overall delivery of solutions to our clients.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Specialist, Production Services Application Support
Job_Description:
Team Overview:
Clearance and Collateral Technology (CCT) builds critical platforms to support the Clearance and Collateral Management line of business and its customers. The Clearance and Collateral Management (CCM) business provides a leading collateral management service globally with over $5 trillion in average balances and global securities clearing and settlement services in 100 markets. In the US, under the wholly owned subsidiary BNYM Government Securities Services (GSS), CCM is the sole provider of US Government clearance & settlement services for all Primary Dealers inclusive of primary & secondary issuance while also supporting all Federal Reserve Open Market Operations settling approximately $11 trillion daily. Given this unique role, GSS and its activities are highly regulated by the US Federal Reserve and governed by an independent Board of Directors CCM is the largest tri-party collateral manager globally with over 60% market share.

Overview of BNY Mellon:
BNY Mellon is a global financial services company focused on helping clients manage and service their financial assets, operating in 36 countries and serving more than 100 markets. BNY Mellon is a leading provider of financial services for institutions, corporations, and high-net-worth individuals, providing superior asset management and wealth management, asset servicing, issuer services, clearing services and treasury services through a worldwide client-focused team.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: 2023 SETUP Technology Full Time Program – Data Scientist - New York
Job_Description:
Overview
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance and technology. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 237 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our ability to evolve, lead and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re more than 50k+ employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself.
Bring your ideas. Make history .
Software Engineering & Technology University Program (S.E.T.U.P)
S.E.T.U.P (Software Engineering & Technology University Program) is an 18-month entry-level technology program that is designed to develop and retain high-potential talent.
The goal of this program is to build a team of technology professionals who are prepared and positioned to contribute to BNY Mellon's technology strategy and initiatives. This program is an immense development and learning opportunity for students with a passion for Technology.
Program highlights
The S.E.T.U.P program is an opportunity not only to learn and grow, but an experience full of diverse community connections, executive engagement, and memorable events. You unlock your full potential here! How? You’re empowered to solve problems and brainstorm ideas in your own unique way.
BNY offers the opportunity to have a direct impact on a wide range of projects, and to create and deliver successful solutions to our clients through a collaborative team setting.
Support for career development and networking from an array of corporate leaders, such as executive mentors, peer mentors, and program managers.
Robust onboarding and training curriculum designed specifically for S.E.T.U.P participants. Gain cross-functional skills by attending learning & development sessions designed by subject matter experts.
After successful completion of the program, high performing SETUPs are aligned to a technology team that would help them utilize and advance the skills acquired during the program.
The possibilities are limitless here - you’ll gain the skills required to advance your career and have a significant impact on our business !!!


US: *New York, NY *Jersey City, NJ


Apply scientific methods to find solutions to real business problems.
Perform data analysis, feature engineering, and advanced methods to prepare and develop decisions based on data.
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods
Provide insight into observed business outcomes through analytics.
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies in data.
Automate data analysis and streamline analytical processes
Provide recommendations based on data trends uncovered when possible
Stays abreast of organization and management changes and has in-depth knowledge of company practices relevant to data science products.
Machine Learning, Feature Engineering and Advanced Analytics capabilities. Stressing expertise in the core functional areas: Computer Programming, Math & Analytic Methodology, Distributed computing, and communications of complex results.


Must be enrolled in an accredited university/college pursuing bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (i.e., Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a similar major with extensive Data Science, Statistics, or related fields.)
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 or above
Does not require sponsorship for employment visa status (now or in the future) in the region where applying


A great attitude and desire for learning
Excellent problem solving, written and oral communication skills
Disciplined self-starter, capable of working independently or in close collaboration
Smart and driven individual who is passionate about learning new technologies
0-2 years of experience in software development preferred. Previous technology internship is a plus
