Title: Specialist, Quality Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview:
"Develops testing plan scenarios for complex unit, process, function, integration, regression and acceptance testing. Assists in identifying and establishing goals for appropriate testing cycles and defines and manages software test environments, test standards and quality assurance tasks. May manage a small team of Test Analysts to ensure quality goals/schedules are met for the given project.Analyzes system requirements and design documents. Estimates hours and resources needed for projects under test. Develops detailed test cases, scenarios and scripts to ensure application quality. Writes test plans, collaborating with other QA and business teams. Designs and develops usability testing scenarios, and administers portions of the testing process, to include the use of testers from other teams. Uses testing tools to plan, execute and track quality assurance artifacts. Meets with PMO, Development and Business to remediate defects.Attends product definition and design meetings, functional and technical walkthroughs in order to provide input in the selection of testing tools and approaches. Identifies test data, test environment setup and test environment configurations needed to prepare for testing. Works with Development, DBAs and business to seed and setup the test environments. Recommends program improvements or corrections. Presents findings to management and project teams Defines criteria for testing, analyzes results of testing sessions and makes recommendations and offers solutions to Quality Assurance leadership and other stakeholders on the project based on the findings. Identifies and documents software and systems defects across products, platforms, and releases. Analyzes complex systems requirements and design documents in order to verify that programs function according to actual requirements and established guidelines.Helps resolve moderately complex problems detected in testing. Provides Triage support to Development, Business and Test teams on internal and external issues.Informs management on resource requirements needed to complete software testing. To include but not limited to the number of testers, test tools, test data test environments and time needed to complete testing.Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Specialist, Quality Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Description
Quality Engineer will inject Quality at each and every step of the SDLC. Will help solve complex automation problems spanning multiple technologies. Will play a key role in Shifting Left and enable CI/CD Pipelines. Will also help with constantly improving the efficiency of the Automation Processes. Attends the required Product Backlog Grooming & Planning Meetings to contribute to the Creation of Effective User Stories. Comes up with comprehensive Regression Suites for Applications & Systems. Solves Complex Automation Challenges spanning multiple technologies in a scalable & extensible manner with least amount of maintenance. Identifies potential risks to the project delivery and escalates them to the Senior QE management so that the team can make the appropriate course correction to meet the timelines. Helps resolves issues detected during testing. Provides QE support to Development, Business and Test teams on internal and external issues. Helps with getting down to the Root Cause of the Issues and works with the Engineering Teams to resolve and Validate the Fixes. Ensures Engineering Teams are adhering to all the Quality Controls in place. Also validates the complete traceability to the Requirements enabling the teams to be Audit Ready. Continuously improves the Efficiency of the Automation using innovative technologies & thought process/Enables Continuous Testing, Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery for the Apps Automated.

Title: Investment Risk Analytics Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Reporting into the Head of Investment Risk Analytics, the Investment Data Specialist will be integral part of the newly created CRO Investment Risk’s team. The Investment Risk Management team has Risk oversight of all investment management activity across the company, executing on our goal of full triangulation of risk management, providing dedicated senior risk coverage of our Investment Management business and other investment activities.
Position Summary
Facilitate the creation and management of a central Investment risk analysis and reporting platform to aggregate risk, performance and liquidity metrics data in a timely, transparent and consistent framework for a large investment management complex
Working within a risk analytics and data team, and cooperatively with risk technology and reporting groups, develop an in-depth understanding of available data sources and appropriately leverage internal systems, databases to build efficient, scalable platform to analyze and report on investment risk

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Investment Risk Analytics Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Job Overview:
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. The job holder leads the technical design, development and documentation of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. S/he analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, and logical processes and interfaces with other systems. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation. Must have thorough and demonstrative knowledge on or both the user-side frontend of a website, as well as the backend, server-side that powers the user-side. Additional requirements include intermediate understanding of security principles, relational databases and architecture design principles. Programming well-designed, testable, efficient code. Analyze, design and develop tests and test-automation suites. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and solutions. Maintain software functionality and currency (technical debt and gain). Actively participate in code reviews. Integrate software components into a fully functional software system. Apply security and privacy principles. Execute full lifecycle software development. Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures. Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems. Ensure software is updated with latest features. Participate in deployment process following all change controls. Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms. Provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Active learning engagement. Complete all required mandatory training / policy awareness curricula on time. Use learning tools such as Pluralsight to complete both recommended and aspirational targets set in personal development plans. Demonstrate team work. Leverage existing products/functionality and promote reuse. Work alongside other engineers on the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices. Collaborate closely with all the other members of the team to take shared responsibility for the overall efforts that the team has committed to. Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, business users, project managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions. Utilize local meetups to gain and share knowledge. Compiles documentation written by more senior developers of all procedures used in system. Acts as mentor to junior level engineers. Prior experience with using a specific application development toolkit and knowledge of front end and backend development coding languages such as C#, Java, HTML, NodeJS, CSS, JSON, Angular, JavaScript. Must also have proficiency in Core Spring, ANSI, Docker. Communications and organization skills; team work skills. N/A. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.

Title: Investment Risk Analytics Data Engineer
Job_Description:
Overview Sr. Specialist User Experience - >
We are actively seeking an energetic and innovative UX Designer to join our group. The Visual Designer (VD) role is an integral part of the team. BNY Mellon IMT is embarking on a transformation into the user experience by incorporating strong Product and Design discipline into the work and services we create.
Create and evolve the visual design language for the products we work on while maintaining awareness of the larger ecosystem of product and design standards.

The products we design must add value while adding minimal complexity. To do our job well, we utilize creative design-led techniques to help us break through the industry jargon and bureaucracy and find insights that others can’t. We elevate UX not just to solve users’ problems but also to use design to steer the product’s evolution into a powerful and extensible framework. You’ll support our client-first mindset to drive efficiency and effectiveness. The successful candidate will join this unique and specialized team that provides clean product design and delivery through the tech team. Working in a professional capacity as a visual designer on highly interactive and data rich applications.

Who We Are
UX Center of Excellence (UX CoE) is part of BNY Mellon Investment Management. Our goal is to improve the User Experience for advisors and customers, ushering in the future tools of Investment Management. Adapting the Lean UX principles, we work closely with teams to shorten the feedback loop and learn from every iteration.

For over 230 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $15 billion in revenues and market capitalization of approximately $50 billion.

About You
Expert at User-centric design approach that involves rapid testing and iteration of designs
You can think through user pain points, find reasonable solutions, mock them up and spec it in detail, and work with engineers to build them
Expert in iconography and building them from scratch
Enjoys the multi-disciplinary and collaborative nature of product development (SDLC)
Detail-oriented and you have a problem-solving mindset
Experience with agile and lean UX methodology and deliverables
Can confidently translate business problems and requirements into compelling wireframes
Experience working in a cross-functional organization, achieving goals through partnership and collaboration (Building relationships with stakeholders)
Ability to work in ambiguity and draw insights from broad data sources
You stay up to date on the industrial latest UX design trends
Strong presentation and communication skills, critical creative thinker and excellent work quality
Be an exceptional multi-tasker who’s quick and organized
Required Qualifications
Minimum (5) years of experience required
Portfolio must be available for review
Expert user of Figma, Sketch, Invision, Axure RP, Jira, Adobe Creative Suite
Design for mobile devices (native and web mobile applications) iOS and Android
Responsive Design for web applications and Branding building a design system
Experience hands-on research, wireframing, prototyping, user personas, journey maps, story maps and user stories at an interactive agency or design studio.
Bachelor's degree in psychology, user experience, computer science, design, human computer interaction, related discipline, or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated ability to work and manage multiple priorities on concurrent, rigorous deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment.
Knowledge of Accessibility / ADA compliance is a plus
Building short animation clips is a plus
Experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Overview
Our Team
Technology Services Group (TSG) powers BNY Mellon by providing scale, capacity, and capability to deliver the critical technology required to operate the global financial services markets.

TSG is defined by three core values:
Creative innovators, delivering excellence and simplicity
Always doing the right thing for the Bank, colleagues, and clients

As part of TSG, the Architecture & Engineering team
Defines enterprise technology and engineering principles and best practices.
Develops next-generation engineering solutions focused on Resiliency and Innovation .
Engineers and integrates the critical systems and platforms used across the Bank and with external Clients.

The Role
We are seeking Senior Collaboration Engineer to join our Workplace Technology Team. You will be a key member of our global team for all end user collaboration for the Bank. You will be responsible for designing the underlying architecture, evaluating existing market products, engineering and strategic deployment for Audio-Visual, Events, Web-Conferencing, Command Centers and Voice Services for the Bank.
Our Workplace Technology team is responsible for the strategy, engineering, and strategic deployment activities for all end user services, including voice, video, mobile services, Windows physical and virtual desktop, Mac, Microsoft 365, email, chat, collaboration, and related technologies. Our mission is to articulate the vision for employee productivity and collaboration for the Bank, selective innovative technologies to transform the end user experience.
If you are a technology evangelist with a passion to deliver technology solutions that differentiate BNY Mellon from its competitors, then this is the place for you.


Manage video conference, event, collaboration, and meeting space deployments at New York Headquarters.
Be accountable end to end for the service delivery of this space, including business case, service offerings and service quality.
Resolve engineering-level escalations of technical issues and disruptions minimizing impact on
talent and audience. Write up AAR reports detailing improvements based on learnings.
Work as part of the team to develop technology strategy and strategic deployment for existing
and future collaboration and meeting spaces, including huddle rooms, meeting rooms, collaboration rooms, boardrooms, auditoriums, command centers, TV quality broadcast studios
and similar.
Own and develop documentation to ensure solutions are operational, resilient, meeting end user needs.
Work to establish event checklists, operational playbooks, runbooks, and create technical
documentation to better map out incremental room improvements.
Maintain key vendor relationships; engage with external partners/agencies where needed to
leverage appropriate services and technology
Technical bench testing and evaluation of new tools to meet growing demands of our clients.
Develop best practices and playbooks around technical operation of key Event Technologies.
Work as a key member of a broader team demonstrating ownership, expertise, and customer
service to the bank.
Work closely with internal stake holders and external vendors to ensure deadlines are met and
ensure clients are trained in the operation of new equipment.


Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience required; advanced degree preferred.10-12 years of related experience required; experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Job_Description:
Overview
About BNY Mellon
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. As of Dec. 31, 2021, BNY Mellon had $46.7 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $2.4 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com . Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.
The Client Transitions team helps Broker Dealers and Advisors to onboard their business to Pershing’s platform. The Client Transition department consists of two primary roles – Account Manager and Specialist. The Account Manager is there to ensure a seamless transition for new clients in compliance with legal and compliance regulations and follows a project management discipline to coordinate activities spanning many teams and topics.
As the Data Specialist you will gather, clean, map, reconcile, test, validate and manage the lifecycle of client demographic or position and balance data from project initiation through to program closure. You will manage and resolve risks, issues, and dependencies. You will report exceptions and statuses to the required business teams, managers and clients. You will serve as a liaison between clients and internal technical groups to ensure delivery of projects on time, within budget, and to specification. Provides advice to internal clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy. Ensures project delivery is in conformance with company methodologies and standards. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives

Business and technology requirements gathering
Data analysis & consultation
Independently handle designated assignments

Organization and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders

Risk assessment, documentation, communication, and escalation
Performs data normalization, constructs data diagrams, and provides data flow diagrams and documents processes.
Performs macro-level analyses to identify trending issues across clients, products, integration or transition activities, etc.
Knowledge of industry regulations and compliance
No direct reports
Researches, develops and establishes methodologies, protocols and processes to facilitate or improve transition project management or the client onboarding/transition/conversion experience

Authentic, innovative, and results-driven? Raise your hand if that sounds like you!

We’re looking for an amazing individual to join our growing team. The longevity of our firm is a testament to its strength and stability. Your ability to contribute fresh and diverse perspectives in a team-based environment will usher us into future and take us to the next level.

For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world's leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. Investment Operations Solutions (Middle Office) Overview
At BNY Mellon, our data-centric service model helps provide clients with clean, scrubbed information to support the investment process, from post-trade execution to client communications. Our Investment Operations solution is a full lifecycle of investment activities through an integrated data, technology and operations model that supports all product types. Offering a full spectrum of services: trade support, derivatives and collateral management, bank loan support, investment book of record (IBOR), investment performance, and data management.
The Trade Support team is the first touch point for our clients' investment activity. We work hand and hand with our investment manager clients, internal teams, custodians, and brokers to capture, confirm, communicate, and settle executed trade activity. Our team provides analytical services to ensure all the activity is processed timely and accurately to meet client and market deadlines.
Middle Office Role Overview
Under minimal supervision, performs moderately complex functions supporting trading, client services, and accounting activities including trade communication, processing, and settlement. Reviews high volumes of client trade activity where established procedures are followed. Leverages some knowledge of processes of procedures to confirm findings and analyses unique scenarios to determine solutions for more complex issues.
Role-Specific Responsibilities
Trade life-cycle management - using systematic tools to capture executed trades (i.e Equity, Fixed Income, FX, and derivatives products) from the clients and communicate/confirm this activity to the 'street': custodians, brokers, and other interested parties
Research exceptions to ensure all activity is accurately processed and delivered by market deadlines
Trade settlement - analyze failed trades and work with all parties to quickly resolve trade settlement issues
with clients as their investment strategies shift and internally to increase efficiency and decrease risk
Management of reference & static data
Standard Job Responsibilities
Middle Office - S2Under minimal supervision, provides accounting and trading support activities for funds of moderate complexity. Performs reviews of moderately complex documents processed from across the Bank to confirm compliance with established processes and procedures. Under minimal supervision, performs moderately complex functions supporting accounting, trading and client services activities including book-keeping and data review. Reviews moderate volume of documents to ensure processors followed established procedures and took on minimal risk. Leverages some knowledge of processes of procedures to confirm findings. Tracks fund data and trades. Maintains records of moderate complexity in accordance with department policies and procedures. Provides requested data to team members. Searches for fail points in processes and drafts error reports to be provided to clients. Has some knowledge of compliance rules and service level agreements. Escalates external errors. Correction of internal errors is at the discretion of the client. Uses some knowledge of what constitutes an exception to review and identify exceptions in documentation. Confirms findings with more senior team members. If exceptions are found, checks against review guidelines to see if internal and client procedures were followed. Prepares system-generated reports or templates and conducts general data validation and reconciliation. Reviews work of junior team members. No direct reports. Provides guidance to less experienced Middle Office support staff, as needed. Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.

High school/secondary school or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Bachelor's degree a preferred (Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics), Mutual fund industry background is a plus.
1-2 years of total work experience preferred.. Experience in accounting support or the mutual fund industry preferred.

Intermediate to advanced understanding of Excel.
High level of communication skills.
Remain organized and be able to handle multiple priorities
Work independently but also be a helpful teammate.
Comfortable asking questions to gain understanding on any area where understanding is limited.

Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Overview
Collateral Operations Team Lead (19925)
Lead Analyst, Client Service (70104)
Grade: I
Hiring Manager: Steven Smith

Who We Are

For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.

BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers

What We Do

Collateral Operations Group Overview
The Collateral Operations group is a global team within the Global Operations & Technology division of BNY Mellon responsible for supporting our clients’ collateral and portfolio reconciliations processes. Our clients include pension funds, endowments, mutual funds, hedge funds and other financial institutions using derivatives to manage their financial risks. We provide processing, inquiry and general support for our clients while working to improve and automate transaction processing systems. We are a center of excellence maximizing specific knowledge around the collateralization of complex derivative products, including swaps, options, forwards, and futures.

Collateral Operations Team Lead Role Overview
The Team Lead will provide daily collateral management and/or collateral reconciliation support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including monitoring collateral inflows from counterparties, facilitating margin dispute resolution between parties and verifying delivery of collateral to clients and brokers. Also included is assisting in the end-to-end reconciliation process, providing oversight of workflow, and ensuring accuracy of information provided to all parties. The successful candidate will handle complex problem resolution and will serve as the intermediary for issue resolution with counter parties and clients. This role will involve client facing exposures. The successful candidate will also participate as a stakeholder in technology projects and enhancements related to collateral infrastructure including for new client onboarding’s. As part of their role, we expect them to supervise a small-to-medium team performing the above actions. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Role-Specific Responsibilities
Oversight of day-to-day client service delivery and quality control
Conduct behavior-based interviews and on-board new team members
Manage resource utilization/load balance, planning, and optimization
Train and develop team members – succession planning and bench strength
Assess operating risks and ensure proper controls
Interface with clients and third parties on service delivery items ensuring we are exceeding client expectations
Demonstrate trust and integrity in all that we do
Foster a positive client relationship and appropriately manage client requests whether directly with the client or internally
Work effectively with peers across teams and sites to create, modify and sustain best practices – demonstrate willingness to be a change agent
Articulate, plan and execute resource utilization/load balancing and optimization across teams
Effectively make day to day decisions independently demonstrating ability to appropriately escalate
Demonstrate proactive engagement with team members in explaining processes and sharing knowledge – explain the “why”
Lead effective meetings with proper agendas both internally and with clients/external parties
Provide facts, details and proposed solutions as items arise; taking ownership to identify solution

Standard Job Responsibilities
Works with external clients to resolve complex day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Supports clients in addressing and resolving complex operational and technical issues and ensuring requests are executed. Applies advanced problem-solving skills, judgement, and experience to analyze information. Uses developed communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides individuals at assigned clients information related to BNY Mellon's products and services representing an array of lines of business and geographies; leverages an in-depth understanding of broader BNY Mellon services and offerings. Proactively assists clients in reviewing potential business needs and directs them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon. May be the central point of contact for business development and assume client onboarding and/or risk management responsibilities
Resolves complex or non-routine client issues or inquires, as needed.
Uses in-depth knowledge of client issues and needs to contribute to business development efforts. Uses understanding of BNY Mellon products and services to best propose expanded offerings to clients for front office consideration.
Leads and participates in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience. Helps develop process improvements.
No direct reports; provides guidance to less experienced team members.
Supports multiple, complex client accounts.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Five to seven (5-7) years of total work experience is preferred.
More than one (1+) year working with derivatives products or two OR more (2+) years working in financial services.
Experience in an operational area and/or client services is preferred. At least one (1) year of team lead or supervisory e

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Job Title: Equity Trade Processing Analyst
Company team & role: BNY Mellon’s Pershing has supported many of the world’s most sophisticated and successful financial services firms for more than 80 years. Wealth and institutional firms rely on us for clearing and custody, trading and settlement services, a broad suite of investment solutions, middle and back office support, data insights, and business consulting. BNY Mellon’s Pershing offers both Wealth Solutions for broker-dealers, registered investment advisors (RIA) and trust company clients, and Institutional Solutions for prime brokers and institutional broker-dealers.
Global Trade Processing is looking for an individual to join our team, which includes trade support for Depository Trust Company (DTC) Fixed Income, Non-US Fixed Income, Government Bonds, and Equity products. Our team is responsible for reconciling trade breaks between Pershing and the clearing agencies such as the National Securities Clearing Corporation (NSCC), obtaining comparisons from contra-brokers, and notifying Pershing clients of trade discrepancies. The role being fulfilled is for Equity Trade Support, which focuses on US stocks, but you will gain experience with various products. We communicate with brokers on behalf of our introducing broker dealer clients.

Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Overview

Who we are:
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment and wealth management and investment services in 35 countries. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com. Follow us on Twitter @BNYMellon or visit our newsroom at www.bnymellon.com/newsroom for the latest company news.

What we do:
Exciting opportunity to join our Execution Services team as a Business Intelligence Reporting Analyst. We are a trading organization providing execution and other trading services to internal asset management clients. Our traders work closely with the investment teams, support, quant research and engineering, as we continue to evolve our trading processes, develop our industry-leading trading technology, and apply rigorous quantitative and market structure research to ensure efficient implementation of investment decisions across a wide range of products.


The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for the design and delivery of a wide range of reports in support of the trading organization.
Commission Management
Produce and distribute monthly overall commission statements to Trading and Senior Management
Prepare Soft Dollar activity reconciliations
Produce and distribute quarterly client reports, and quarterly and annual board reports, on commission activity, including soft dollars
Ensure compliance with appropriate regulatory regimes regarding client commission usage across all relevant global markets
Implement, oversee, and report on all client-directed commission requests, while ensuring compliance with all strategy-based target percentage guidelines
Brokerage Activity Reporting
Produce monthly Dashboard Reports for Investment Team Leads, Trading and Senior Management
Produce Broker Briefing Reports as needed to support Senior management, PM and Trading dialogue with sell-side counterparties
Continuously review, update, and consolidate existing activity reports and dashboards to reflect current needs, convey relevant insight and limit unnecessary redundancy
Benchmarking I Ensure Alignment with Industry Best Practices
Develop and maintain understanding of market structure globally and across asset classes.
Coordinate participation in trading benchmark surveys
Collaborate with consultants/benchmark vendors to review and update survey questions to reflect current relevant industry trends
Leverage existing relationships with consultants/benchmark vendors to increase the breadth and depth of relevant benchmarking data regarding brokerage practices, commission usage and order handling practices, while identifying and developing new sources of relevant data and insight
Manage internal record of benchmarking data and monitor tracking reports for indicated changes


Experience with Institutional Trading, TCA, Commission Management and Regulation.
Experience in reporting across asset classes, globally.
Degree in computer science, statistics or similar.
5+ years of relevant experience in a reporting or analytical function.
Expertise in dealing with large data sets and strong analytical skills.
Collegial and collaborative disposition – team player!
Great presentation skills – be able to present findings to a wide range of audiences.


Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Advanced degree in quantitative analysis preferred.
5-7 years of experience preferred.
Experience in quantitative finance and technology preferred.

Company_Name: ['The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation', '3.7']
Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Job Overview:
Consults with internal business groups to provide appropriate application software development services or technical support. Provides application software development services or technical support in more complex situations. May also be responsible for requirements gathering and BRD/SRD preparation. Has thorough knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle. Conducts reviews of the test Plan and test Data. May allocate/ coordinate work within a team/project. The job holder leads the technical design, development and documentation of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. S/he analyzes, defines and documents requirements for data, workflow, and logical processes and interfaces with other systems. S/he also ensures that expected application performance levels are achieved by coordinating, coding, testing, implementation and documentation. Must have thorough and demonstrative knowledge on or both the user-side frontend of a website, as well as the backend, server-side that powers the user-side. Additional requirements include intermediate understanding of security principles, relational databases and architecture design principles. Programming well-designed, testable, efficient code. Analyze, design and develop tests and test-automation suites. Develop flowcharts, layouts and documentation to satisfy requirements and solutions. Maintain software functionality and currency (technical debt and gain). Actively participate in code reviews. Integrate software components into a fully functional software system. Apply security and privacy principles. Execute full lifecycle software development. Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures. Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems. Ensure software is updated with latest features. Participate in deployment process following all change controls. Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms. Provide recommendations for continuous improvement. Active learning engagement. Complete all required mandatory training / policy awareness curricula on time. Use learning tools such as Pluralsight to complete both recommended and aspirational targets set in personal development plans. Demonstrate team work. Leverage existing products/functionality and promote reuse. Work alongside other engineers on the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices. Collaborate closely with all the other members of the team to take shared responsibility for the overall efforts that the team has committed to. Collaborate cross-functionally with data engineers, business users, project managers and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions. Utilize local meetups to gain and share knowledge. Compiles documentation written by more senior developers of all procedures used in system. Acts as mentor to junior level engineers. Prior experience with using a specific application development toolkit and knowledge of front end and backend development coding languages such as C#, Java, HTML, NodeJS, CSS, JSON, Angular, JavaScript. Must also have proficiency in Core Spring, ANSI, Docker. Communications and organization skills; team work skills. N/A. Contributes to the achievement of area objectives.

Company_Name: ['BNY Mellon', '3.7']
Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
Overview
Treasury Services Technology (TST) is a premier technology organization that supports the Treasury Services (TS) business. TST provides technology solutions that enable clients to move money and associated information quickly, safely, and reliably around the world. We partner with our business and operations colleagues to deliver high-quality performance in global payments, trade services, and cash management. Together, we are able to combine diverse services into solutions that help clients streamline transactions, optimize cash flow, manage liquidity, and make payments more efficiently in capital markets around the world. Treasury Services is leveraging the expertise of our talent to drive our digital journey. Within Treasury Services, digital can be viewed as the intersection of our business functions with technology, which acts as an enabler for digitization.
The Global Payments and Liquidity function within TST enables the clearing and settlement of payments across the globe, electronic and paper-based payables/receivables solutions and deposit account servicing and management of client’s cash.
The Bank of New York Mellon is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to specialize in payments processing transformation and digitization. The Business Analyst will work with the team to ensure that business requirements are successfully and efficiently transitioned into working software.


Elicits and challenges business requirements through an inquisitive mindset
Creates user stories for to capture functional requirements for projects ranging from small functional enhancements to large multi-year transformations
Drives business architectural solutions focused on flexibility, time to market and re-usability
Collaborates with business and technology partners to provide a seamless experience to users when interacting with payments systems
Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems, and provide guidance to team members on complex testing tasks including use case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution
Collaborates with business and technology teams to develop strategic technology roadmap
Demonstrates strong business and technical knowledge in Payment Processing - initiation to settlement and tracking
Participates in the design of functions leveraging payment messaging formats such as MT, MX, ISO200022 standards and FED/CHIP and interoperability among these formats
Supports payment files processes - US ACH and International ACH payment schemes and processes
Qualifications
This is talent pipeline requisition.

reporting, planning, issue / risk tracking, scheduling, effort estimation and day-to-day tracking, and other project documentation preparation.

Job_Description:
Overview
Job Title: Lead Analyst

Job Description:
Pershing Operations, Trading and India Services (OTIS) business unit is responsible for managing the Operational processes within OTIS of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation. This internal control position is within the Internal Control Team of the Client & Product Billing department, which is responsible for implementing and maintaining contractual obligations between Pershing and the Introducing Firms (IF) as well as obligations between IF and the end investors for various products and services. The Internal Control Team is responsible for maintaining internal control framework, executing quality assurance programs as First Line of Defense (1LOD) and performing various review functions that are designed to promote accuracy and completeness of contract implementation and periodic billing services. The Team interacts across Finance, Operational Risk Control and Client Segments whilst furthering risk management culture within OTIS and across the organization.
Pershing provides a flexible and progressive work environment - roles can be hybrid in nature depending on the needs of the employee and the business.


Responsible for conducting contract implementation reviews to ensure accuracy and completeness of contract setup in various systems
Validate fee schedules captured in the systems and analyze financial impacts for any identified issues
Apply risk and control consideration into day-to-day functions
Participate in various projects focusing on automating the certain manual process to enhance accuracy and efficiency
Collaborate with teams across contract implementation, IT liaison and client service seeking strategic solutions for complex products
Provide management insights and recommendations to mitigate identified risks associated with the process and systems


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or relevant majors
A minimum of 5 years finance or operations experience in the financial industry
Audit or internal control experience is a plus


Attention to details and ability to research and understand business processes ensuring processes and control functions are being met
Ability to organize and present data in a meaningful way, including analyzing and summarizing detailed information to highlight the issues
Solid problem-solving skill and ability to connect dots
Sense of ownership and accountability for work
Ability to multi-task, work within a team environment and collaborate with peers
Possess an adequate level of technical skills such as Excel and Word PowerPoint, willing to learn proprietary technologies, i.e. core applications used by the firm

What You'll Do:
The Middle Office Trade Support Lead Analyst plays a critical role in the Middle Office Operations department within The Markets Operations Group at BNY Mellon. This team serves as a central liaison to the front office and is responsible for the support of day-to-day trading activities, life cycle events, portfolio/cashflow reconciliation, project management, and ad hoc requests from the multiple desks that we support. The team supports many different product types which include: Equities, Derivatives (Futures/Options & OTC), FX, and Swaps (Interest Rates/ FX Currency/Total Return). The incumbent must possess a strong Risk and Control mindset to drive change and automation across process, procedure, controls, and IT architecture. The ideal candidate should be a strong SME in the TRS and Equity Business with end-to-end knowledge of front to back flows. In the fast-paced trading environment, the incumbent is required to possess 1) Strong communication/escalation skills 2) Intellectual curiosity to learn, question, adapt, and pivot 3) The ability to multi-task and prioritize.

Title: Analyst, Data Management & Quantitative Analysis
Job_Description:
About BNY Mellon
BNY Mellon is a leading Global Systemically Important Financial Institution that is dedicated to helping clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Our Investment Management and Investment Services businesses help individuals and institutions invest, conduct business, and transact in markets all over the world. BNY Mellon’s employees are in 35 countries and serve more than 100 markets. BNY Mellon has approximately $45 trillion in assets under custody and administration, and $2.3 trillion of assets under management. In addition, the Company is the world’s largest provider of Corporate Trust and Depositary Receipt services and a leading provider of Broker Dealer, Liquidity, Payment and Global Markets services. BNY Mellon ranks as the 7th largest global asset manager.
About This Opportunity – Senior Analyst, Credit Management Group



BNY Mellon assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $45,700 and $97,500 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNYM total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs.
This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
